# Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Decree-Law No. 8 of 2025
### Amending the text of Article (251) of the Civil Code issued by Decree-Law No. (67) of 1980

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 G,
- And the Civil Code issued by Decree-Law No. (67) of 1980, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning ministerial substitutions and delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And upon the submission of the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### Article One
The text of paragraph (1) of Article (251) of the aforementioned Civil Code shall be replaced with the following text:
((1- The full Diyah <orig>الدية</orig> (blood money) shall be estimated at twenty thousand dinars)).

### Article Two
The ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

**Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>**
**Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

**Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>**
**Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>**

**Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>**
**Counselor/ Nasser Yousef Mohammed Al-Sumait <orig>ناصر يوسف محمد السميط</orig>**
Issued at Seif Palace on: 6 Ramadan 1446 H
Corresponding to: 6 March 2025 G

## Explanatory Memorandum
### For Decree-Law No. 8 of 2025 Amending the Text of Article (251) of the Civil Code Issued by Decree-Law No. (67) of 1980

The Civil Code was issued by Decree-Law No. (67) of 1980, and Article (251), clause (1) stipulated that ((The full Diyah <orig>الدية</orig> shall be estimated at ten thousand dinars. Its amount may be amended by decree)). In explaining this, the memorandum accompanying the Civil Code clarified that ((The origin of Diyah <orig>الدية</orig>, according to the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشرع الإسلامي</orig>, is determined as one hundred camels. Under this noble Sharia, there is nothing to prevent its amount from being determined in currency. The legislator has permitted the amendment of the monetary amount of the Diyah <orig>الدية</orig> it set, in order to provide the opportunity to keep it consistently aligned with price levels. Amending the monetary amount of the Diyah <orig>الدية</orig> is an established principle in Islamic jurisprudence (Fiqh <orig>الفقه الإسلامي</orig>). The evidence for this is what was narrated that the Diyah <orig>الدية</orig> during the era of the Prophet, may God's best prayers be upon him, was eight hundred dinars or eight thousand dirhams, and it remained so until Omar became Caliph. He saw that the prices of camels had risen, so he increased the Diyah <orig>الدية</orig> to one thousand dinars or twelve thousand dirhams (Al-Madhhab, Part 2, p. 210). The draft preferred to make the amendment of the Diyah <orig>الدية</orig> amount by decree, for the sake of speed and ease in its procedure)).

More than forty years have passed since this regulation, during which financial and economic conditions have changed. There has been a noticeable increase in individual income, met with a steady decline in the purchasing power of money, such that the estimate stipulated in the aforementioned article no longer reflects the true amount of the Diyah <orig>الدية</orig> as prescribed by Sharia. Hence, this draft law was introduced to rectify this imbalance, reaffirm the sanctity of life, provide a means for just compensation, and establish reasons for sparing the blood of the innocent, given the undeniable role of the Sharia-prescribed Diyah <orig>الدية الشرعية</orig> in deterring aggressors and discouraging the impulses of others. This necessitated the provision to set the amount of the Sharia-prescribed Diyah <orig>الدية الشرعية</orig> at twenty thousand dinars.

Practical experience has proven the ineffectiveness of referring to a special decree to re-estimate the value of the Sharia-prescribed Diyah <orig>الدية الشرعية</orig> while its value is stipulated in the body of the law. Furthermore, it could lead to ambiguity and legislative instability, which necessitated making this amendment and removing the text that permits amending the Diyah <orig>الدية</orig> amount by decree, and instead relying on the estimate provided in the law.

There is no impediment in Sharia or in law to reconsidering the value of the Sharia-prescribed Diyah <orig>الدية الشرعية</orig> again whenever new justifications arise, but this should be done through clear and organized legislative procedures that ensure the stability of the legal system.

And as the Amiri Order was issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024, and Article (4) thereof stipulates that laws shall be issued by decree-laws, the present draft Decree-Law has been prepared.

Its first article provides for the replacement of clause (1) of Article (251) of the aforementioned Civil Code and raises the value of the Diyah <orig>الدية</orig> to 20 thousand dinars. Its second article obliges both the Council of Ministers and the ministers to implement it and put it into effect from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.
<page_end>2</page_end>

# Decree-Law No. 9 of 2025
## Repealing the text of Article 153 of the Penal Code issued by Law No. (16) of 1960

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhul-Qa'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 G,
- And the Penal Code issued by Law No. (16) of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding ministerial substitutions and delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And upon the submission of the Minister of Justice,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### Article One
Article No. 153 of the aforementioned Penal Code is hereby repealed.

### Article Two
The Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law. It shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come into force from the date of its publication.

**Amir of Kuwait**
**Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

**Prime Minister**
**Ahmad Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>**

**Minister of Justice**
**Counselor/ Nasser Yousef Mohammed Al-Sumait <orig>ناصر يوسف محمد السميط</orig>**

Issued at Seif Palace on: 6 Ramadan 1446 H
Corresponding to: 6 March 2025 G

# Explanatory Memorandum
## For Decree-Law No. 9 of 2025 Repealing the text of Article 153 of the Penal Code issued by Law No. (16) of 1960

Whereas the Constitution, in Article (29), guarantees equality among people in human dignity, and in public rights and duties, and prohibits discrimination among them on the basis of sex, origin, language, or religion; and whereas Article (153) of the Penal Code issued by Law No. 16 of 1960 included a provision for a mitigating legal excuse for the penalty of a man who commits the crime of killing his wife, mother, daughter, or sister upon surprising her in the act of adultery (in flagrante delicto); and whereas restricting this excuse to men and not women constitutes discrimination between them on the basis of sex, on the grounds of the provocation of a man's feelings by this crime, despite the fact that a woman has the same feelings, especially since mitigating the penalty for this crime contributes to its prevalence.

Furthermore, its provision conflicts with the obligations of the State of Kuwait established under international charters and conventions, particularly the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women. That Declaration included the establishment of a common standard that states should aim for in defining the rights that must be protected, and affirmed that all are equal in rights, and that both men and women have the right to enjoy them without discrimination based on race, color, or sex, and that they are equal in rights at the time of marriage, during the marriage, and at its dissolution. The Convention on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women also included a provision criminalizing such discrimination and, in its second article, obligated states to take all appropriate measures, including the repeal of provisions of national penal codes that constitute discrimination against women, which necessitates, as previously stated, the repeal of this article due to the discrimination against women it represents, which contradicts the Constitution and Kuwait's international obligations. Therefore, in commitment to this international obligation, and as the Amiri Order was issued on 10 May 2024, with its Article (4) stipulating that laws shall be issued by decree-laws, the present draft Decree-Law has been prepared. Its first article provides for the repeal of the aforementioned Article 153, and its second article obligates all ministers to implement it, publish it in the Official Gazette, and for it to come into force from the date of its publication.

# Explanatory Memorandum
## To Decree-Law No. 10 of 2025 Amending the Text of Article (26) of Law No. (51) of 1984 Regarding Personal Status

Based on the Constitution of the State of Kuwait, which affirms the protection of the family, motherhood, and childhood, and in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia, while also observing Kuwait's international obligations, particularly the Convention on the Rights of the Child, which defines a child as anyone who has not reached the age of eighteen and obligates states to protect them from early marriage, and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women, which ensures the free and full consent of the spouses and encourages setting a minimum age for marriage. Therefore, it was deemed appropriate to replace Article (26) of Law No. (51) of 1984 Regarding Personal Status in a manner that prohibits the documentation of marriage unless both spouses have reached the age of eighteen.

And whereas the Amiri Order was issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024, and stipulated in its Article (4) that laws shall be issued by decree-laws, therefore, the present draft decree-law has been prepared. Its first article provides for the replacement of Article (26) of the aforementioned Law No. (51) of 1984, and prohibits the documentation or ratification of a marriage contract for anyone who has not reached the age of 18 at the time of documentation. Its second article obligates the Prime Minister and the Ministers to implement this decree-law, to be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

# Decree-Law No. 10 of 2025
## Amending the Text of Article (26) of Law No. (51) of 1984 Regarding Personal Status

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. (51) of 1984 Regarding Personal Status,
- And Law No. (21) of 2015 Regarding the Rights of the Child,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 Regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the proposal of the Minister of Justice,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,

**We have issued the following Decree-Law:**

### Article One

The text of Article (26) of the aforementioned Law No. (51) of 1984 shall be replaced with the following text:

**Article (26)**
((The documentation or ratification of a marriage contract is prohibited for anyone who has not reached the age of eighteen at the time of documentation)).

### Article Two

The Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law. It shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come into force from the date of its publication.

**Amir of Kuwait**
**Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

**Acting Prime Minister**
**Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>**

**Minister of Justice**
**Counselor / Nasser Yousef Mohammed Al-Sumait <orig>ناصر يوسف محمد السميط</orig>**

Corresponding to: 6 March 2025 AD# Decree-Law No. 11 of 2025

# Explanatory Memorandum
## To Decree-Law <orig>المرسوم بقانون</orig> No. 11 of 2025
## Amending the text of Article (15) of the Ja'fari Personal Status Law <orig>قانون الأحوال الشخصية الجعفرية</orig> issued by Law No. (124) of 2019

Based on the Constitution of the State of Kuwait <orig>دستور دولة الكويت</orig>, which affirms the protection of the family, motherhood, and childhood, and in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>, while also considering Kuwait's international obligations, particularly the Convention on the Rights of the Child, which defines a child as anyone under the age of eighteen and obligates states to protect them from early marriage, and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women, which ensures the free and full consent of the spouses and encourages setting a minimum age for marriage, it was deemed appropriate to add a new paragraph to the text of Article (15) of the Ja'fari Personal Status Law <orig>قانون الأحوال الشخصية الجعفرية</orig> issued by Law No. (124) of 2019, in a manner that prohibits the notarization of a marriage unless both spouses have reached the age of eighteen.

And whereas the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> was issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024, and Article (4) thereof stipulated that laws shall be issued by decree-laws, therefore, the present draft Decree-Law has been prepared. Its first article provides for the addition of a new paragraph to the text of Article (15) of the Ja'fari Personal Status Law <orig>قانون الأحوال الشخصية الجعفرية</orig>, stipulating that a marriage contract shall not be notarized or authenticated for anyone who has not reached the age of 18 at the time of notarization. Its second article stipulates that the Prime Minister and the ministers must implement this Decree-Law, that it be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and that it shall come into force from the date of its publication.
<page_end>5</page_end>

# Decree-Law No. 12 of 2025 Amending Article (2) of Law No. (88) of 1995 Regarding the Trial of Ministers

Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And the Penal Code issued by Law No. (16) of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And the Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials issued by Law No. (17) of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (88) of 1995 regarding the Trial of Ministers, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (2) of 2016 regarding the establishment of the Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> and the provisions for Financial Disclosure,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding ministerial successions and deputations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the proposal of the Minister of Justice,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

## Article One
The text of clause (f) of Article (2) of the aforementioned Law No. (88) of 1995 shall be replaced with the following text:
f - The crimes stipulated in Law No. (2) of 2016 regarding the establishment of the Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> and the provisions for Financial Disclosure.

## Article Two
The ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Explanatory Memorandum for Decree-Law No. 12 of 2025 Amending Article (2) of Law No. (88) of 1995 Regarding the Trial of Ministers

The Constitutional Court <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig> issued its ruling in direct appeal No. (24) of (2015) in its session on 20/12/2015, declaring the unconstitutionality of Decree-Law No. (24) of 2012 on the establishment of the Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> and the provisions for Financial Disclosure. This led to the annulment of the provision of clause (f) of Article Two of Law No. (88) of 1995 regarding the Trial of Ministers, which was added by Law No. (29) of 2014, stipulating that the crimes provided for in the law ruled unconstitutional fall within its scope of application. This resulted in a legislative vacuum in this regard.

As Law No. (2) of 2016 was issued regarding the establishment of the Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> and Financial Disclosure to replace the law ruled unconstitutional, and it included an enumeration of the categories subject to its provisions, among them ministers, it became necessary, to achieve the legislator's objectives in issuing the law on the trial of ministers, to consolidate the jurisdiction for investigation and trial concerning crimes attributed to ministers related to their capacity and official duties.

Therefore, it was deemed appropriate to prepare the accompanying draft Decree-Law to amend Article Two of the aforementioned law by replacing the text of clause (f) with another that includes the crimes stipulated in the aforementioned Law No. (2) of 2016.

# Decree-Law No. 13 of 2025
## Approving the Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait, represented by the Kuwaiti Ministry of Defense, and the Government of the United Arab Emirates, represented by ADG Holding Group for Industrial Procurement P.J.S.C., concerning Defense Procurement and Industries

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And upon the submission of the Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig>,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### Article One
Approval is granted for the Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait, represented by the Kuwaiti Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع الكويتية</orig>, and the Government of the United Arab Emirates <orig>حكومة دولة الإمارات العربية المتحدة</orig>, represented by ADG Holding Group for Industrial Procurement P.J.S.C. <orig>مجموعة أ د ج القابضة في مجال المشتريات الصناعية ش.م.ع</orig>, concerning Defense Procurement and Industries, signed in the city of Abu Dhabi <orig>أبوظبي</orig> on 2/9/2024, the text of which is attached to this Decree-Law.

### Article Two
The Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Explanatory Note
## To Decree-Law No. 13 of 2025 Approving the Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait, represented by the Kuwaiti Ministry of Defense, and the Government of the United Arab Emirates, represented by ADG Holding Group for Industrial Procurement P.J.S.C., concerning Defense Procurement and Industries

Desiring to develop and enhance cooperative relations, especially in the field of defense procurement and industries, within an institutional framework consistent with approved strategic plans, a Memorandum of Understanding was signed on 2/9/2024 in the city of Abu Dhabi <orig>أبو ظبي</orig> between the Government of the State of Kuwait, represented by the Kuwaiti Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع الكويتية</orig>, and the Government of the United Arab Emirates <orig>حكومة دولة الإمارات العربية المتحدة</orig>, represented by ADG Holding Group for Industrial Procurement P.J.S.C. <orig>مجموعة أ د ج القابضة في مجال المشتريات الصناعية ش.م.ع</orig>, concerning Defense Procurement and Industries. This Memorandum consists of ten articles.

Article (One) addressed the objective of the Memorandum of Understanding, which is to establish preliminary requirements for the First Party and to support the foundations and relations of cooperation in the field of defense industries and military armament between the two parties on the basis of mutual benefit that the Second Party can provide. Article (Two) identified the implementing bodies of this Memorandum for both parties. Article (Three) included the areas of cooperation between the two parties, such as: the production and supply of medium and large caliber bombs, capacity building in the field of ammunition and bombs, and providing solutions and capabilities based on the requirements of the Government of the State of Kuwait to support strategic security needs.

Article (Four) stipulated the formation of a joint executive committee comprising an equal number of representatives from both parties. The joint committee shall hold its meetings at times and locations agreed upon by both parties. The decisions of the joint committee shall be made with the consent of both parties, and comprehensive minutes of the committee's meetings shall be prepared.

Article (Five) regulated financial matters, whereby each party shall bear the costs and expenses for the purpose of implementing this Memorandum, except in cases stipulated otherwise regarding benefits received by one party that are detrimental to the interests of the other party. Each party shall independently determine the extent of confidentiality of the materials delivered under this Memorandum.

Article (Seven) disclosed general provisions, including that each party shall respect the applicable laws of the other party while present on its territory, and that this Memorandum of Understanding does not constitute a legally binding contract between the parties. Article (Eight) specified the method for official notifications between the two parties, which shall be through official channels and the addresses provided in the Memorandum of Understanding, or other addresses that must be notified in writing to both parties.

Article (Nine) stipulated that in the event of any dispute arising from the interpretation or implementation of this Memorandum, the two parties shall work to settle this dispute through diplomatic channels and through consultations and negotiations.
Finally, Article (Ten) reviewed the final provisions regarding the entry into force of the Memorandum of Understanding, as well as how to amend and terminate it.
As this Memorandum of Understanding serves the interests of both countries and does not conflict with the commitments of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in the Arab and international spheres, and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> has requested the preparation of the necessary legal instrument for ratification.
Whereas this Memorandum of Understanding is considered among the agreements mentioned in the second paragraph of Article (70) of the Constitution, and therefore its approval shall be by law in accordance with the provision of this paragraph.
And as the Amiri Order was issued on 10/5/2024, and Article (4) thereof stipulated that laws shall be issued by decrees-by-law, therefore, the draft decree-by-law at hand was prepared for its approval. Article (1) thereof stipulated the approval of this Memorandum, and Article (2) thereof obligated the ministers - each within their respective jurisdiction - to implement this decree-by-law, to be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>. Therefore, the draft decree-by-law for its approval has been prepared along with its explanatory memorandum.

# Memorandum of Understanding
Between the Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>حكومة دولة الكويت</orig>, represented by the Kuwaiti Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع الكويتية</orig>, and the Government of the United Arab Emirates <orig>حكومة دولة الإمارات العربية المتحدة</orig>, [represented by the] UAE Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع الإماراتية</orig>, represented by EDGE Group Holding <orig>مجموعة أدج القابضة</orig> for Industrial Procurement P.J.S.C., concerning Defense Procurement and Industries

## Preamble:
The Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>حكومة دولة الكويت</orig>, represented by the Kuwaiti Ministry of Defense / for the State of Kuwait, hereinafter referred to as (the First Party), and the Government of the United Arab Emirates <orig>حكومة دولة الإمارات العربية المتحدة</orig> / represented by EDGE Group Holding <orig>مجموعة أدج القابضة</orig> for Industrial Procurement P.J.S.C. concerning Defense Procurement and Industries, hereinafter referred to as (the Second Party).
Referred to individually as a (Party) and collectively as (the Parties). Recognizing the brotherly and friendly relations existing between the two countries and their peoples.
Whereas the purpose of signing this Memorandum of Understanding is to develop and enhance cooperation relations between them, especially in the field of defense procurement and industries, within an institutional framework that is consistent and does not conflict with the obligations, competencies, and authorities of each, and in a manner that aligns with the strategic plans of both Parties.

## Article 1
### Objective
This Memorandum of Understanding aims to establish the initial requirements for the First Party and to support the foundations and relations of cooperation in the field of defense industries and military armament between the two Parties on the basis of mutual benefit that the Second Party can provide.

## Article 2
### Implementing Authorities
The First Party: On behalf of the Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>حكومة دولة الكويت</orig>, represented by the Kuwaiti Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع الكويتية</orig>.
The Second Party: On behalf of the Government of the United Arab Emirates <orig>حكومة دولة الإمارات المتحدة</orig>, represented by EDGE Group Holding <orig>مجموعة أدج القابضة</orig> for Industrial Procurement P.J.S.C.

## Article 3
### Areas of Cooperation
1. To promote, develop, and implement the sharing of scientific knowledge and exchange of expertise in the field of operational environmental governance for the defense production sector, industrial capacity building in the defense field, and the diversification of official trade exchange areas to include defense industries.
2. To provide solutions and capabilities based on the requirements of the Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>حكومة دولة الكويت</orig> to support strategic security needs.
3. The Second Party shall cooperate in providing all means of cooperation and the requirements of the First Party with respect to the Group's activities, including but not limited to:
   - a. Small arms and various types of ammunition.
   - b. Naval vessels of various sizes, as well as naval drones.
   - c. Military vehicles of various sizes and for various uses, as well as land drones.
   - d. Precision-guided munitions, guided missiles and bombs, or unmanned aerial vehicles.
   - e. Smart surveillance camera systems.
   - f. The field of communications, electronic, and cyber warfare.
4. To exchange expertise, information, and available resources between them in the field of installing and integrating missile systems on various defense platforms.
5. To explore opportunities for the localization of production where it is economically feasible to support a long-term, sustainable strategic industry to serve the region.
6. Production and supply of medium and large caliber bombs.
7. Capacity building in the field of ammunition and bomb refurbishment.
8. Any other areas agreed upon by the two Parties to be provided later through the authorized entities of each Party.

## Article 4
### Joint Committee
1. If the two Parties agree in writing, a joint executive committee (the Joint Committee) shall be formed, to be completed within thirty days of the signing of this Memorandum, and it must include an equal number of representatives from both Parties.
2. The meetings of the Joint Committee shall be held at times and locations agreed upon by the two Parties from time to time. The meetings of the Joint Committee may be held via video conference between the members, if some or all of them are in different locations.

3. Decisions of the Joint Committee shall be taken with the approval of both Parties. In the event of a persistent disagreement or if the Joint Committee fails to reach an agreement, the relevant authorities in the governments of both Parties shall be addressed regarding the matter in question to prepare a decision thereon. If the relevant decision-makers in the governments of both Parties do not resolve the matter, discussion on the matter in question may be cancelled if it does not result in harm to either Party.
4. Comprehensive minutes of the Joint Committee's meetings shall be prepared and circulated between the Parties.
5. The Joint Committee may review and submit non-binding proposals and recommendations to the government and the administration of the Second Party.

## Article 5
### Financial Matters
1. Each Party shall bear the costs and expenses incurred by the Parties and their affiliates in connection with the conclusion of this Memorandum of Understanding, except in cases where this Memorandum provides otherwise or if the two Parties agree otherwise in writing after the date of concluding this Memorandum.
2. The payment mechanism and procurement costs shall be determined through more detailed implementing protocols and arrangements to be agreed upon by the Parties at a later date and based on this Memorandum of Understanding.

## Article 6
### Security Information
1. Any information regarding military cooperation transmitted under this Memorandum of Understanding, regardless of its form and content, shall be used exclusively for the purposes of implementing this Memorandum.
2. Information related to military cooperation received by one Party shall not be used in a manner that harms the interests of the other Party.
3. The Parties undertake not to deliver any exchanged or jointly created information within the framework of implementing this Memorandum of Understanding to any third party without the prior written consent of the other Party.
4. Each Party shall independently determine (mutually or in the case of implementing a mutual action) the level of confidentiality of the materials delivered under this Memorandum or which originated as a result of its implementation.
5. The confidentiality levels of this information are classified with the following marking:

| Confidential | Restricted |
| Restricted | |

6. The Party that has received information on military cooperation, for which the sending Party has stipulated the need for confidentiality, shall ensure its protection and treat it in accordance with the provisions of its state's legislation governing the treatment of information of a similar nature, even after the expiration of this Memorandum of Understanding.
7. The other Party shall be notified in advance of the need to respect the confidentiality of information related to military cooperation or as stipulated in the contracts (agreements - protocols) that the Parties may subsequently conclude within the framework of implementing this Memorandum of Understanding.
8. Representatives of the Parties shall be admitted to military facilities in accordance with the procedure stipulated in the legislation of the host state (unless international treaties to which one of the Parties is a party provide otherwise).

## Article 7
### General Provisions
1. Each Party shall respect the applicable laws of the other Party while present on its territory.
2. The provisions of this Memorandum of Understanding shall not affect the obligations of either Party arising from other international treaties and agreements to which either is a party.
3. This Memorandum of Understanding does not constitute a legally binding contract between the Parties.
4. The Parties may conclude more detailed implementing protocols and arrangements for the purpose of implementing this Memorandum.

## Article 8
### Official Notifications
Pursuant to the provisions of this Memorandum of Understanding, all notifications between the Parties shall be sent through official channels to the addresses listed below or to such other addresses as must be notified in writing.

### Dispute Settlement

## Article 10
### Entry into Force, Duration, Amendment, and Termination
1. This Memorandum of Understanding shall enter into force from the date of receipt of the last written notification through diplomatic channels by which the Parties notify each other of the completion of their internal / legal / constitutional procedures required for its entry into force.
2. This Memorandum of Understanding may be amended by mutual written consent of both Parties at any time, and such amendments shall enter into force in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the first paragraph of this Article.
3. 4. In the event of the termination of this Memorandum, the projects being implemented in accordance with this Memorandum of Understanding shall remain in effect until their completion.

# Decree No. 41 of 2025 Amending the Text of Article (6) of Decree No. 95 of 2017 on the Formation of Committees for Military Material Procurement and Military Facility Contracts, and their Mechanism, Procedures, and Oversight

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. 49 of 2016 regarding Public Tenders, and its amending laws,

# Council of Ministers Decision No. 195 of 2025 Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship Certificates from Certain Individuals

**Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>**
- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to May 10, 2024 AD,
- And Article (21 bis "A") of Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 concerning the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding ministerial substitutions and delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And upon the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,

**Has Decided**

## Article One
The Kuwaiti citizenship certificates shall be withdrawn from the individuals listed below, and Kuwaiti citizenship shall be withdrawn from any person who may have acquired it by dependency from the holder of said certificate:

4. Mufreh Abdullah Mohammed Hadi Dhiban Al-Ajmi <orig>مفرح عبد الله محمد هادي ذيبان العجمي</orig>.
5. Faisal Maatouq Mjaidi' Al-Otaibi <orig>فيصل معتوق مجيديع العتيبي</orig>.
6. Hawraa Mohammed Ismail Mohammed Hassan Ismail <orig>حوراء محمد إسماعيل محمد حسن إسماعيل</orig>.
7. Fayez Nasser Salem Hussein Abdulhadi Abujumah Al-Ajmi <orig>فايز ناصر سالم حسين عبد الهادي ابوجمه العجمي</orig>.
8. Ali Manahi Ayed Shatran Al-Ajmi <orig>علي مناحي عايض شتران العجمي</orig>.
9. Munif Barakat Nahis Afdaighem Al-Rashidi <orig>منيف بركات ناهس افديغم الرشيدي</orig>.
10. Mubarak Mohammed Hadi Dhiban Al-Ajmi <orig>مبارك محمد هادي ذيبان العجمي</orig>.

## Article Two
The First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior shall implement this decision. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

**Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>**

A decision shall be issued by the Council of Ministers naming the members of the committee, and this decision shall include the remuneration designated for the chairman, vice-chairman, members, and secretariat of the committee.

### Article Two
The committee shall be responsible for receiving, considering, examining, and studying grievances submitted by those whose Kuwaiti nationality has been withdrawn or revoked, or whose nationality certificate has been withdrawn. It shall also prepare the necessary recommendations and submit proposals within the framework of the applicable laws, regulations, and decisions.

### Article Three
The committee shall hold its meetings at the headquarters of the General Secretariat of the Council of Ministers. Its meetings may be held at any other location by a decision of its chairman. The committee shall convene upon the invitation of its chairman, and whenever the need arises.
For a meeting of the committee to be valid, the attendance of an absolute majority of its members is required, including the chairman or vice-chairman. The committee's deliberations shall be confidential, and its decisions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the members present. In the event of a tie, the side of the session's chairman shall prevail.
The committee may seek the assistance of any experts and competent persons it deems appropriate to perform its work, and it may invite them to attend its meetings without having a counted vote.

### Article Four
The committee shall, in its first meeting, establish its rules of procedure and determine the time frame for the subjects falling within its jurisdiction.

### Article Five
The committee has the right to contact any entity to obtain the data necessary to carry out its work, and all entities must assist it in this regard.

### Article Six
The General Secretariat of the Council of Ministers shall undertake the secretariat duties for the committee, prepare its work, receive grievances submitted to the committee, present them immediately to the committee's chairman, complete the data and information related to them, study them, and submit a report on each grievance to the committee. A decision organizing the secretariat and appointing the secretary shall be issued by the Minister of State for Cabinet Affairs.

### Article Seven
The term of the committee's work is one year, commencing from the date of its first meeting. This term may be extended for other similar periods by a decision of the Council of Ministers whenever the need arises.

### Article Eight
Immediately upon the issuance of the decision for its formation, the committee shall announce on government communication platforms, or by any means it deems appropriate, the commencement of its work, the mechanism for communicating with it, and the procedure for submitting grievances to it.

### Article Nine
The committee shall prepare periodic reports on the progress of its work and a final report at the end of its term on the results of its work, which shall include recommendations and proposals regarding the grievances presented to it, or any other matter related to its work. These reports shall be submitted to the Council of Ministers for consideration.

### Article Ten
All concerned authorities must implement this decision. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

**Acting Prime Minister**
**Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>**

Corresponding to: 11 March 2025 AD

# "Decision"

## Article (1)

For the purposes of implementing the provisions of this Decision, the following terms shall have the meanings assigned to each:
- Decoders: Devices for decoding.
- Receiver: A reception device.
- Receivers: Devices that receive signals from wave transmitters.
- Channels: The link between transmitting and receiving devices (transmission occurs via designated channels and reception occurs via those channels).
- Accounting Systems: The application of the financial accounting systems established in the State of Kuwait and by the Ministry of Finance, and the provisions contained in the circulars of the Minister of Finance in this regard.
- Financial Rules: The set of regulations that achieve internal control over the Ministry's financial expenditures and revenues in accordance with the circulars of the Ministry of Finance in this regard.
- The Ministry's Technical Body: The Engineering Affairs Sector.
- The Ministry's Competent Authority: The Press, Publishing, and Publications Sector.
- The Competent Ministry: The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الاعلام</orig>.
- The Competent Minister: The Minister of Information <orig>وزير الاعلام</orig>.

## Article (2)

Approval for a permit to import audio-visual channel receivers equipped with separate decoders, and any devices that include decoding technology, requires prior authorization from the competent authority at the Ministry.

## Article (3)

Subject to the provisions of Law No. 111 of 2013 regarding the regulation of commercial shop licenses, it is not permissible to import or sell decoders, receivers that include decoders for audio-visual channels, or any devices that include decoding technology before obtaining a license to practice this activity from the competent authority at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>.

## Article (4)

The application for an import permit license shall be submitted by the entities or companies holding the rights to the encrypted audio-visual media content, on the form designated for this purpose, to the competent authority at the Ministry, stating the applicant's name, address, and capacity as a right holder of the content, and the type and number of devices for which the import permit is requested. The competent authority at the Ministry will then refer the application to the Ministry's competent technical body to provide a technical opinion on the permissibility of granting the permit.

## Article (5)

The Ministry's competent technical body shall provide its opinion on the permit application within ten working days from the date of its receipt. The competent authority at the Ministry shall decide on the permit application within one month from the date of submission, either by accepting, rejecting, or amending it. Furthermore, customs clearance for the permitted devices shall not be granted until a certificate is obtained from the competent authority at the Ministry stating that the imported devices are allowed entry.

## Article (6)

The Ministry shall not incur any obligations or third-party rights as a result of granting or denying an import permit. The granting of the permit shall not prejudice the rights of concerned parties related to the circulation or sale of such devices.

## Article (7)

The Undersecretary of the competent authority at the Ministry shall issue the import permit for the requested devices according to the designated form after the requesting entity submits a prior permit application for the devices to be imported by filling out the form prepared for this purpose. The permit shall be for a single use and its validity shall be for one year from the date of its issuance.
In the event that the Ministry's competent technical body requests a sample of the devices for which an import or release permit is sought, the entity requesting the permit shall be obligated to pay a device inspection fee to the Ministry in the amount of (10) ten dinars.

## Article (8)

An appeal may be filed against the decision to refuse the permit or to refuse its renewal within ten days from the date the applicant is notified of the decision. The appeal shall be submitted to the Undersecretary of the Ministry and shall be decided upon within ten days from the date of its submission. The decision issued on the appeal shall be final.

## Article (9)

The import permit issued under this Decision is personal and may not be assigned or transferred to others, in whole or in part, without prior approval from the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>. The Ministry must be notified of any change that occurs to any of the details of this permit.

## Article (10)

Without prejudice to any more severe penalty prescribed by another law, anyone who violates this Decision shall be punished with the penalties stipulated in the Penal Code, along with the closure of the shop in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 111 of 2013 regarding the regulation of commercial shop licenses, and shall also be subject to the following penalties: -1.

- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (46) of 2025 regarding the approval of the organizational structure of the Supreme Council for Family Affairs <orig>المجلس الأعلى لشؤون الأسرة</orig>.
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.

**Has Decided**

### Article One
The detailed competencies of the Social Insinuation Office <orig>مكتب الإيماء الاجتماعي</orig> shall be transferred to the Supreme Council for Family Affairs <orig>المجلس الأعلى لشؤون الأسرة</orig>.

### Article Two
Any provision that contradicts the provisions of this resolution shall be repealed.

### Article Three
The provisions of this resolution shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette, and the competent authorities shall implement its contents.

**Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs <orig>وزير الشؤون الاجتماعية وشؤون الأسرة والطفولة</orig>**
**Dr. Amthal Hadi Haif Al-Huwailah <orig>د. أمثال هادي هايف الحويلة</orig>**

# Administrative Decision No. (9) of 2025 Regarding the Cancellation of the License for the Electronic Media Outlet Named (Al-Safir Newspaper)

The Assistant Undersecretary for the Press, Publishing, and Publications Sector:
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (8) of 2016 on the Regulation of Electronic Media,
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (100) of 2016 issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. 8 of 2016 on the Regulation of Electronic Media,
- And Administrative Decision No. 655 of 2022 regarding the delegation of certain competencies,
- And Electronic Media License No. 82/2017 issued on 11/1/2017,
- And the request submitted by the license holder on 6/3/2025,
- And the letter from the Director of the Electronic Publishing Department No. 18 dated 6/3/2025, and based on the requirements of the public interest.

**Has Decided**

### Article One
License No. 82/2017 for the media outlet •Al-Safir Newspaper is hereby canceled by law, based on the request of the license holder, in accordance with the last paragraph of clause (8) of Article (16) of the aforementioned Law No. (8) of 2016 on the Regulation of Electronic Media.

### Article Two
The concerned parties shall be notified of this decision, and it shall be published on the Ministry's website and in the Official Gazette.

**Assistant Undersecretary for the Press, Publishing, and Publications Sector <orig>وكيل الوزارة المساعد لقطاع الصحافة والنشر والمطبوعات</orig>**

- And based on the requirements of the public interest.

**It is decided**

### Article One
The text of Article (16), paragraph (f) of the Civil Service Council <orig>مجلس الخدمة المدنية</orig> Decision No. 5 of 2010, referred to above, shall be replaced with the following text:
- Physicians who are assigned to be on-call for a period of at least four days per month and no more than eight days per month, outside of scheduled working hours, shall be granted an on-call allowance in accordance with Table No. (1) attached to this decision.
- In the event that a physician is not on duty due to annual leave or otherwise, they shall be paid for the on-call days they actually performed, and the rest shall be deducted.
- "Senior General Practitioner (A)" and "Senior General Practitioner (B)" shall, after each reaches the end of their job's salary scale, be granted an on-call allowance at the rate prescribed for the next higher position, provided they work under the on-call system.
- The on-call allowance category listed in Table No. (1) attached to this decision for physicians in the three medical levels "Consultant," "Senior Specialist," and "Specialist/Senior General Practitioner (A)" shall be increased in the case of overnight stay by "80" Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> per month for category (A), and by "50" Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> per month for category (B).
- It is not permissible to combine this allowance with work under the shift system. Physicians may be assigned to work overtime outside of official working hours on days other than those on which they are assigned to be on-call.

- And upon the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> Circular No. 1 of 2023 regarding auctions in public entities.
- And upon the request of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> regarding the necessity of offering the utilization of sites operated by third parties at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> through a public auction.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. 394 of 2016 regarding the regulation of investment controls for the utilization of sites belonging to hospitals and centers affiliated with the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> by third parties.
- And upon the letter of the Assistant Undersecretary for Services Affairs, dated 10/9/2024, which includes the request for approval to amend the investment regulation issued under the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. 394 of 2016.
- And based on the requirements of the public interest and what was presented to us by the Undersecretary of the Ministry.

**It is decided**

## Article One
The following terms, as they appear in this regulation, shall have the following meanings:
a) The Ministry – The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
b) The Minister – The Minister of Health <orig>وزير الصحة</orig>.
c) The Sites – Open land spaces or vacant properties owned by the Ministry, in accordance with the systems, laws, and instructions.
d) Investment – The employment and operation of sites belonging to the Ministry with the aim of preserving and developing them and benefiting from their financial returns to provide and improve services.
e) Public Auction – The leasing of sites belonging to the Ministry with the aim of achieving the highest price by inviting the largest possible number of investors to participate.
f) The Investor – The natural or legal person or persons who are entitled to practice commercial and investment activities under the laws and regulations of the Ministry of Commerce.

## Article Two
The General Services Department (Services Affairs Sector) is entrusted with the jurisdictions and tasks of following up on the investment and utilization of all sites belonging to the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> by third parties, in coordination with the concerned authorities within the Ministry, as follows:
1- Receiving requests from health districts and departments regarding the utilization of sites for approved activities, and requests received from investors wishing to invest in one of the Ministry's sites, to study them and take necessary action.
2- Following up on auction contracts concluded with investors to ensure their compliance with the terms and conditions of the auction.
3- Following up on payments due from investors to the Ministry and ensuring their commitment to the due payments according to the terms and conditions of the auction contract, in coordination with the Financial Affairs department.
4- Preparing the terms and specifications booklet for auctions with the concerned departments.

## Article Three
All necessary measures shall be taken to obtain the approvals of the state's regulatory authorities for all documents and contracts related to the investment and utilization of sites by third parties, in accordance with the procedures and laws regulating this, in coordination with the Financial Affairs apparatus.

## Article Four
Approval of an investment project is conditional upon adherence to the following:
1- Any entity wishing to invest in the utilization of sites shall submit a request to the General Services Department.
2- The request shall specify the total area of the site intended for investment.
3- The type of activity for which investment is sought must be specified.
4- The estimated value of the investment must be determined.
5- The investment must be in one of the following activities:
- a - Cafeteria.
- b - Coffee shop.
- c - Sweets shop.
- d - Restaurant.
- e - Gifts, accessories, and pastries.
- f - Printing and photocopying.
- g - Flower shop.
- h - Automated Teller Machine (ATM).
- i - Bank branch.
- j - Vending machines for sweets and juices.
- k - Grocery store.
- l - Dental care and hygiene supplies.
- m - Shops for selling medical supplies.
- n - Valet and car parking service.
- o - Nursery / Daycare.
- p - Sale of phone accessories.

## Article Five
New activities, other than those specified in clause five of Article Three of this decision, may be added based on a recommendation from the Services Sector and the approval of the Minister.

## Article Six
The same activity may not be repeated by more than one investor, nor may other activities or additional spaces be added, except upon a recommendation from the Services Sector and the approval of the Minister.

## Article Seven
Regions, departments, or any other entity may not independently invest in any of the activities except in accordance with the regulations and conditions stipulated in these bylaws.

## Article Eight
Ministry employees and their first and second-degree relatives are prohibited from applying for investment in sites belonging to the Ministry.

## Article Nine
The General Services Department shall receive investment applications for regions and sites and prepare the bidding terms and conditions booklet in preparation for sending it to the Financial Affairs Department to conduct the bidding process in accordance with the circular issued by the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> in this regard.

## Article Ten
The General Services Department shall study the bids submitted by investors and issue the necessary recommendation for awarding the contract, in preparation for sending it to the Financial Affairs Department to complete the contracting procedures according to the established regulations and systems in this regard. The Department shall also follow up on the implementation of contracts throughout their validity period through periodic and unannounced inspections of all sites covered by the contracts, ensure compliance with general and special conditions, and verify the health requirements for cafeteria workers in coordination and cooperation with the competent authorities in the Ministry. In the event that the investor withdraws from completing the contracting procedures or in the case of contract termination for any reason, the General Services Department has the right to re-offer the site intended for investment for the same activity based on the requirements of the public interest.

## Article Eleven
The General Services Department shall visit all sites belonging to the Ministry, propose necessary activities, and present them to the concerned entity for investment in the sites. In the event of approval of the activity, the General Services Department shall take the necessary measures in accordance with the regulations and conditions stipulated in these bylaws.

## Article Twelve
The leasing of any site belonging to the Ministry intended for investment and utilization shall only be done through a public auction.

## Article Thirteen
The property or site may not be used by the investor for any purpose other than that for which it was designated.

## Article Fourteen
The investor may not sublease the property to a third party, taking into account the conditions stipulated in the bidding booklet.

## Article Fifteen
The Ministry may terminate or rescind the contract with the investor for reasons of public interest.

## Article Sixteen
The contract period shall be calculated from the date the investor receives the site from the Ministry, vacant and by virtue of a handover report, provided that this does not exceed one month from the date of signing the contract, taking into account the conditions stipulated in the bidding booklet.

## Article Seventeen
In the event the investor is late in signing the site handover report, they shall be notified at their registered address with the administrative authority, and the contract period shall be calculated from the date of notification, taking into account the conditions stipulated in the bidding booklet.

## Article Eighteen
The lease term shall be specified in the contract and stipulated in the terms and conditions booklet on a case-by-case basis, taking into account the circular issued by the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> in this regard.

## Article Nineteen
The health and engineering requirements, the inspection and monitoring mechanism, and the responsible authority must be taken into account and specified when preparing the bidding booklet, according to the type of activity.

## Article Twenty
These bylaws shall apply to all sites owned or utilized by the Ministry.

## Article Twenty-One
This decision shall be communicated to whom it may concern for its implementation, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance. Any decision or text that contradicts the provisions of this decision is hereby repealed. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Minister of Health
Dr. Ahmed Abdulwahab Al-Awadhi <orig>د. أحمد عبد الوهاب العوضي</orig>

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
## Ministerial Decision No. 148 of 2025

The Minister of Justice:
- Having reviewed the Constitution.
- And Decree-Law No. 38 of 1980 promulgating the Civil and Commercial Procedure Law and its amendments.
- And Decree-Law No. 23 of 1990 concerning the Judicial Organization Law and its amendments.
- And the decision of the Supreme Judicial Council <orig>المجلس الأعلى للقضاء</orig> in its session No. (7/2025) held on 16/2/2025.
- And upon joint coordination with all competent authorities.
- And Ministerial Decision No. (119/2025) issued on 3/3/2025.
- And the letter of the Counselor/ President of the Court of First Instance No. (80874) dated 9/3/2025.
- And as required by the public interest.

### Has Decided
### Article One
The Criminal Circuits of the Court of First Instance shall be relocated from their current headquarters at the Justice Palace to their new headquarters located in the new Justice Palace building, effective Sunday, 16/3/2025.

### Article Two
The Undersecretary of the Ministry shall implement this decision in coordination with all concerned parties.

### Article Three
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette.

**Minister of Justice**
**Counselor/ Nasser Yousef Al-Sumait <orig>ناصر يوسف السميط</orig>**

Issued on: 12 Ramadan 1446 H
Corresponding to: 12 March 2025 AD

# Ministerial Decision No. (15) of 2025 Regarding the Assignment of the Director General of the Public Institution for Social Security

The Minister of Finance and Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment,

Having reviewed:
- The Social Security Law issued by Amiri Order by Law No. (61) of 1976 and its amending laws,
- And Amiri Decree No. (140) of 2024 regarding a cabinet reshuffle,
- And Decision No. (14) of 2025 terminating the assignment of Mr. Khaled Jassim Ibrahim Al-Mudhaf <orig>خالد جاسم إبراهيم المضف</orig> – Deputy Director General of the Public Institution for Social Security, issued on 6/3/2025,
- And in accordance with the powers vested in us,
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.

We have decided the following:
(Article One)
Mr. Khaled Jassim Ibrahim Al-Mudhaf <orig>خالد جاسم إبراهيم المضف</orig> is assigned as Director General <orig>مديراً عاماً</orig> of the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> until a new Director General is appointed.

(Article Two)
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, and it shall come into force from the date of its issuance and be published in the Official Gazette.

Minister of Finance

Appendix No. (7) (Petition Form for a Decision of the Disciplinary Board) shall be added to Book Three (Law Enforcement) of the Executive Bylaws of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and their amendments, in accordance with Annex No. (2) of this decision.

## Annex (1)
<table_caption>Annex (1): Amendments to the Executive Bylaws</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Article | Type of Amendment | Text Before Amendment | Text After Amendment |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| 1 | 18-5 | Amendment by Addition | Petition for reconsideration of the Disciplinary Board's decisions | Petition for reconsideration of the Disciplinary Board's decisions. The Authority may submit a petition for reconsideration of the decisions issued by the Disciplinary Board based on the reasons it deems appropriate. Any person against whom a penalty stipulated in the Law has been issued may also submit a petition for reconsideration of the decision issued by the Disciplinary Board after paying the prescribed fee, based on the reasons stated in Appendix No. (8) of this Book. Petitions shall be submitted to the Disciplinary Board within three working days from the date of notification of the decision. The Disciplinary Board shall decide on the petition within five working days from the date of its submission. These procedures shall not interrupt the legal deadlines for submitting a grievance or appeal against the decisions of the Disciplinary Board. |
</table>

# Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>
## Administrative Decision No. 37/2025 GM Regarding the Suspension of the Engineering Office / Saleh Abdul Ghani Al-Mutawa for Engineering Consultancy <orig>صالح عبد الغني المطوع للاستشارات الهندسية</orig> – Owned by Engineer / Saleh Abdul Ghani Abdul Redha Al-Mutawa <orig>صالح عبد الغني عبد الرضا المطوع</orig>

Director General of the Municipality
- Having reviewed Law No. (33/2016) concerning Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> and its amendments.
- And Ministerial Decision No. (123/2021) issuing the regulation for the practice of the profession for engineering offices and consulting firms and its amendments.
- And Ministerial Decision No. (363/2009) concerning the organization of the executive body of the Municipality and its branches in the governorates.
- And Ministerial Decision No. (206/2009) concerning the regulation of construction works and its attached schedules dated 30/4/2009 and its amendments.
- And Administrative Decision No. (A2024/781) dated 27/5/2024 concerning the reconstitution of the Committee for Regulating the Practice of the Profession for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms.
- And Administrative Decision No. (374/2021) dated 25/10/2021 concerning the renewal of the registration of the engineering office.
- And the letter from the Committee for the Practice of the Profession for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms No. (00020-2024) dated 12/12/2024.
- And the recommendation of the Committee in its meeting No. (13/2024) held on 10/12/2024 regarding the suspension of the engineering office.

**Has Decided**

### Article One
To approve the recommendation of the Committee made in meeting No. (13/2024) held on 10/12/2024 to suspend the office of / Saleh Abdul Ghani Al-Mutawa for Engineering Consultancy <orig>صالح عبد الغني المطوع للاستشارات الهندسية</orig>, owned by Engineer / Saleh Abdul Ghani Abdul Redha Al-Mutawa <orig>صالح عبد الغني عبد الرضا المطوع</orig> – a temporary suspension (for a period of one year) – based on clause No. (3) of the text of Article (29) of the regulation for the practice of the profession for engineering offices and consulting firms issued by Ministerial Decision No. (123/2021), to commence from the date of expiry of the penalty issued under Decision No. (28/2025) dated 19/2/2025.

### Article Two

## Announcement
### Regarding the issuance of Tender No. (29 - 2024/2025)
The General Secretariat of the Council of Ministers <orig>الأمانة العامة لمجلس الوزراء</orig> announces the issuance of a public tender "non-divisible" among specialized companies, No. (29 - 2024/2025), concerning the network connectivity and internet services project for the Central Agency for Addressing the Situations of Illegal Residents <orig>الجهاز المركزي لمعالجة أوضاع المقيمين بصورة غير قانونية</orig>, in accordance with the general specifications and conditions contained in the tender documents, which can be obtained from the General Secretariat of the Council of Ministers <orig>الأمانة العامة لمجلس الوزراء</orig> – Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف العامر</orig> – Gate No. (4) during official working hours.

<table_caption>Tender Schedule and Pricing</table_caption>
<table>
| Issuance | Closing | Price |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Monday, 2025/03/17 | Tuesday, 2025/04/08 at 12:00 PM, Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف العامر</orig>, Gate No. (4) | 75/- K.D. non-refundable |
</table>

Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the date of opening the envelopes.
The preliminary guarantee amounts to (2%) of the bid value, and it must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity and issued in the name of the General Secretariat of the Council of Ministers <orig>الأمانة العامة لمجلس الوزراء</orig>.

Please bring the following documents to obtain the terms and conditions booklet:
1. A valid registration certificate from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
2. A valid registration certificate from the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>.
3. A valid certificate from the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> (Civil Entity Number).
4. A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage.
5. An authorization letter and a copy of the Civil ID of the company's representative for purchasing the booklet.

For inquiries, please contact the Contracts and Tenders Department <orig>مراقبة العقود والمناقصات</orig>:

## Announcement
The owners of the company: King Cross for Selling Mobile Phone Accessories ## Company Under Liquidation
have submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry to carry out: Dissolution and liquidation of the company. Legal entity: Limited Liability Company.
Anyone with an objection is requested to file a claim with the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of this announcement's publication, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection will result in the continued liability of the joint partners (in the case of a general partnership or simple limited partnership only) towards this creditor until a final judgment is rendered on the objection.

On Thursday, 20/02/2025, at exactly eleven o'clock in the morning, at the company's headquarters – ASEECO Industrial for Prefabricated Buildings and Constructions Company) in the Sulaibiya Industrial Area <orig>منطقة الصليبية الصناعية</orig>, Block 1, Plot 8, 18 B. – the Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of ASEECO Industrial for Prefabricated Buildings and Constructions Company (K.S.C.C) <orig>شركة أسيكو الصناعية للمباني الجاهزة والإنشاءات (ش.م.ك.م)</orig> held its extraordinary meeting for the fiscal year ending on 31/12/2023.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Hamad Faisal Sayed Abdulwahab Al-Rifai <orig>حمد فيصل سيد عبدالوهاب الرفاعي</orig> – Deputy Chairman of the Board of Directors. The following also attended:

2. Mr. Ahmed Nawwar <orig>احمد نوار</orig> representing Al-Bazie & Co. office <orig>مكتب البزيع</orig>, the company's auditor (via modern communication methods)

Al-Amana Warehousing Company (Closed) <orig>شركة الأمانة للمخازن (مقفلة)</orig>

**Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting**

The General Assembly of the shareholders of Al-Amana Warehousing Company (Closed) <orig>شركة الأمانة للمخازن (مقفلة)</orig> held its extraordinary meeting at 11:00 AM on Tuesday, January 14, 2025, at the company's headquarters located at: Al-Dhajeej <orig>الضجيج</orig>, Boubyan Complex, Ground Floor, Office 21.
The meeting was chaired by Ms. Noura Mohammed Abdullah Al-Mutawa <orig>نورة محمد عبدالله المطوع</orig> in her capacity as a member of the Board of Directors and a proxy for the shareholders.
In the presence of:-
1 – Mr. Nasser Saud Al-Manea <orig>ناصر سعود المنيع</orig>, representing the Gulf Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الاوراق المالية</orig>.
After the legal quorum was declared with an attendance of 100% for the validity of the company's General Assembly meeting, Ms. Noura Mohammed Abdullah Al-Mutawa <orig>نورة محمد عبدالله المطوع</orig> opened the meeting session, welcoming the attendees. Then, the item on the agenda was presented for discussion, and the following took place:-
First: Consideration of the company's future.

**Resolutions:**
After deliberation and discussion, the Extraordinary General Assembly adopted the following resolutions:
1. Approval of the liquidation of Al-Amana Warehousing Company <orig>شركة الأمانة للمخازن</orig> due to continued financial losses and the non-viability of continuing its activities.
2. Authorizing the Chairman of the Board of Directors, or his representative, to take all necessary legal measures to complete the liquidation process.
3. Recommending the appointment of the International Accounting Office – Certified Public Accountants, Ahmed Salem Al-Shammari <orig>احمد سالم الشمري</orig>, as the company's liquidator, to be voted on at the next Extraordinary General Assembly.

At the end of the meeting, Ms. Noura Mohammed Abdullah Al-Mutawa <orig>نورة محمد عبدالله المطوع</orig>, in her capacity as a member of the Board of Directors and a proxy for the shareholders, thanked the attendees and concluded the Assembly's proceedings.

# Kuwait Financial Group Holding Company <orig>شركة مجموعة المالية الكويتية القابضة</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The company's Extraordinary General Assembly held its meeting at 11:30 AM on Monday, 03/03/2025, at the headquarters of Kuwait Real Estate Company, located in the Souk Al-Kuwait building - Entrance A - Eighth Floor - Meeting Room 1, chaired by Mr. Mohammed Nouri Al-Hamad <orig>محمد نوري الحمد</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and CEO, and in the presence of shareholders representing 9,999,796 shares, a ratio of 99.998%, and in the presence of Mr. Mahmoud Mazen Jamal <orig>محمود مازن جمال</orig> - the company's external auditor from the office of Al-Qatami & Al-Aiban and Partners <orig>القطامي والعيبان وشركاهم</orig> - Grant Thornton for auditing accounts.
After the Chairman of the meeting announced that the legal quorum for convening was met, he opened the meeting session, welcoming the attendees and reciting the Board of Directors' report.
Thereafter, the item on the agenda of the convened Extraordinary General Assembly was put forward for discussion, and these discussions resulted in

**The unanimous approval by the attendees to amend the following article of the company's Articles of Association:**

<table_caption>Comparison of Article (15) of the Articles of Association Before and After Amendment</table_caption>
<table>
| Article After Amendment | Article Before Amendment |
|:---|:---|
| **Article (15) of the Articles of Association** | **Article (15) of the Articles of Association** |
| The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of three members elected by the General Assembly of shareholders by secret ballot. Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board of Directors, except to the extent that exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representative on the Board of Directors. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives on their behalf to the Board of Directors in proportion to their combined ownership. These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members, and the shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders. | The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of six members elected by the General Assembly of shareholders by secret ballot. Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board of Directors, except to the extent that exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representative on the Board of Directors. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives on their behalf to the Board of Directors in proportion to their combined ownership. These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members, and the shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders. |
</table>

At the conclusion of the meeting, the Chairman, Mr. Mohammed Nouri Al-Hamad <orig>محمد نوري الحمد</orig>, thanked the attendees, and the proceedings of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting were concluded at 11:45 AM.

# Al-Murr Holding Company (K.S.C. Closed) <orig>شركة المر القابضة</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Thursday, February 20, 2025, the Extraordinary General Assembly of Al-Murr Holding Company (K.S.C. Closed) <orig>شركة المر القابضة</orig> was held at 11:00 AM at the company's management headquarters, in the presence of the shareholders and chaired by:–
Mr. Yousef Issa Abdullah Al-Othman <orig>يوسف عيسى عبدالله العثمان</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chairman of the Assembly
The Chairman of the Board of Directors opened the session by welcoming the attendees and thanking them for their presence. The items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly were discussed, and the legal quorum for the General Assembly's attendance, amounting to 100% in person and by proxy, was announced. Thus, the quorum for the General Assembly was declared complete, and the following was approved:–
**First: Approval was granted to align the company's activities according to the international classification:**

Second: Approval was granted to amend Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association:
The purposes for which the company was established are:
Current Text (Before Amendment):
1- Owning shares in Kuwaiti or foreign shareholding companies, as well as owning shares or stakes in Kuwaiti or foreign limited liability companies, or participating in the establishment, management, lending, and guaranteeing of these companies of both types to third parties.
2- Lending to companies in which it owns shares and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20%.
3- Owning movable and real estate properties necessary to conduct its activities within the limits permitted by law.
4- Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial models, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiaries and other companies.
5- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
The company may conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either directly or through an agent. The company may have an interest in or associate in any way with entities that conduct activities similar to its own or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, purchase, or annex such entities.
Proposed Text (After Amendment):
1- Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent (642040).
2- Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial models, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary holding companies and others (642050).
3- Owning the real estate and movable properties necessary to conduct its business within the limits permitted by law (642030).
4- Owning shares for the account of the holding company only (642051).
5- Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities (642020).
6- Buying and selling shares and bonds for the company's account (649917).
7- Managing its subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies in which it contributes and providing the necessary support to them (642010).
The company may conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either directly or through an agent. The company may have an interest in or associate in any way with entities that conduct activities similar to its own or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, purchase, or annex such entities.
* This is subject to the approval of the competent authorities.
The meeting concluded at 12:00 PM.
