## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Sunday, 02/03/2025 AD, at 11:30 AM, the Extraordinary General Assembly of Dalqan Holding Group Company <orig>شركة مجموعة دلقان القابضة</orig> convened at the company's headquarters in Al-Ardiya Industrial Area <orig>العارضية الصناعية</orig>, Block 2, Plot 100 <orig>قطعة 2 قسيمة 100</orig>.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. / Abdullah Saud Al-Mutairi <orig>عبد الله سعود المطيري</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, and attendance was 100%. The discussion of the agenda began as follows:

- First Item: Approval was granted to amend the Articles of Association of Dalqan Holding Group Company <orig>شركة مجموعة دلقان القابضة</orig> as follows:

1.  **Amendment to the text of Article (13) of the Articles of Association, as follows:**
    -   **Text before amendment:**
        "The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of (3) members elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot."
    -   **Text after amendment:**
        "The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of (5) members. The shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot.
        Each shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board of Directors, except to the extent that their shareholding exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representatives to the Board of Directors. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives on their behalf to the Board of Directors, in proportion to their combined ownership. These representatives shall have the same rights and obligations as elected members. The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.
        The company's General Assembly must elect from among the members of the Board of Directors one or more independent members with experience and competence. Their remuneration shall be determined in accordance with governance rules, provided that their number does not exceed half of the board members. It is not required for the member to be among the company's shareholders.
        The same members may be re-elected or re-appointed for more than one term."

2.  **Amendment to the text of Article (14) of the Articles of Association, as follows:**
    -   **Text before amendment:**
        "The term of membership on the Board of Directors is three years, renewable."
    -   **Text after amendment:**
        "The term of membership on the Board of Directors is three years, renewable. If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors on the specified date, the existing board shall continue to manage the company's business until the reasons preventing the election are resolved and a new Board of Directors is elected."

3.  **Amendment to the text of Article (15) of the Articles of Association, as follows:**
    -   **Text before amendment:**
        "A member of the Board of Directors is required to own, in their personal capacity, or the legal entity they represent must own, a number of shares with a value of not less than 7,500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> or 1% of the capital, whichever is less. If, at the time of their election, the member does not own or represent this number of shares, they must acquire them within one month of their election, otherwise their membership will be forfeited. The legal entity shall be responsible for the actions of its representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders."
    -   **Text after amendment:**
        "A candidate for membership on the Board of Directors must meet the following conditions:
        1) They must have the legal capacity to act.
        2) They must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a penalty restricting freedom, or a crime of bankruptcy by default or fraud, or a crime against honor or integrity, or a penalty restricting freedom for violating the provisions of the law, unless they have been rehabilitated.
        3) They must own, in their personal capacity or the person they represent, a number of the company's shares. The independent board member is exempt from this condition.
        If a board member loses any of the preceding conditions or other conditions stipulated in the Commercial Companies Law or other applicable laws, their membership status shall cease from the date of losing that condition. This shall not affect the validity of the actions and decisions taken by the participating member or in which they participated in voting."

4.  **Amendment to the text of Article (16) of the Articles of Association, as follows:**
    -   **Text before amendment:**
        "The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of this board may not have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and transactions concluded with or on behalf of the company, except with authorization from the General Assembly. None of them may participate in the management of a similar or competing company. The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any of its members, even if representing a legal entity, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position for their own benefit or for the benefit of others. Furthermore, they may not sell or buy the company's shares throughout their term of membership on the Board of Directors."
    -   **Text after amendment:**
        "The Chairman or a member of the Board of Directors, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain a benefit for themselves or others.
        A board member may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the board, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in applicable laws, the company's contract, or these Articles.
        Members of the Board of Directors may not disclose to shareholders outside of General Assembly meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they have become aware of in the course of their management duties; otherwise, they shall be subject to removal and held liable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.
        The Chairman of the Board of Directors, any member of this board, the executive management, or their spouses or second-degree relatives may not have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and transactions concluded with or on behalf of the company, except with authorization from the General Assembly. The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of the board may not hold membership on the boards of two competing companies, nor participate in any work that would compete with the company, nor trade for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity pursued by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to claim compensation from them or to consider the transactions they conducted for their own account as having been conducted for the company's account, unless this is approved by the Ordinary General Assembly."

5.  **Amendment to the text of Article (19) of the Articles of Association, as follows:**
    -   **Text before amendment:**
        "The company shall have one or more Chief Executive Officers appointed by the Board of Directors from among the board members or from outside, who shall be entrusted with managing the company. The board shall determine their remuneration and powers of signature on behalf of the company. The positions of Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer may be combined."
    -   **Text after amendment:**
        "The company may have one or more Chief Executive Officers appointed by the Board of Directors from among the board members or from outside, who shall be entrusted with managing the company. The board shall determine their remuneration and powers of signature

It is not permissible to combine the positions of Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer. The Board of Directors may distribute the work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to carry out one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activities, or exercise some of the powers or competencies vested in the Board."

6. Amendment to the text of Article (27) of the Articles of Association, as follows:
– Text before amendment:
"The Chairman of the Board of Directors and its members are responsible for their actions towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of power, any violation of the provisions of the law or these Articles, and for mismanagement. A vote by the General Assembly to discharge the Board of Directors from liability shall not prevent the filing of a liability lawsuit."
– Text after amendment:
"The Chairman of the Board of Directors and its members are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of power, any violation of the law or the company's contract, or for mismanagement. A vote by the General Assembly to discharge the Board of Directors from liability shall not prevent the filing of a liability lawsuit. Members of the Board of Directors may not participate in voting on General Assembly resolutions related to discharging them from liability for their management, or those related to a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or a dispute between them and the company.
This liability shall be either a personal liability attached to a specific member, or a joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable for paying compensation, except for those who objected to the resolution that established the liability and had their objection recorded in the minutes.
Furthermore, the company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors for errors that result in damages to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall file the lawsuit.
Any shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party so that compensation may be awarded to it, if warranted. A shareholder may also file a personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them harm. Any agreement to the contrary shall be void."

7. Amendment to the text of Article (29) of the Articles of Association, as follows:
– Text before amendment:
"In cases where the General Assembly may be convened at the request of shareholders, auditors, or the Ministry of Commerce and Industry, the agenda shall be set by the party requesting the meeting. No matter not listed on the agenda may be discussed."
– Text after amendment:
"In cases where the General Assembly may be convened at the request of shareholders, auditors, or the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, the agenda shall be set by the party requesting the meeting. The General Assembly may not discuss topics not listed on the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or were discovered during the meeting, or if requested by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, the auditor, or a number of shareholders holding five percent of the company's capital.
If it becomes apparent during the discussion that the information regarding some of the matters presented is insufficient, the meeting must be postponed for a period not exceeding ten days if requested by a number of shareholders representing one-quarter of the issued share capital. The postponed meeting shall be convened without the need for new invitation procedures."

8. Amendment to the text of Article (30) of the Articles of Association, as follows:
– Text before amendment:
"Each shareholder has a number of votes equal to the number of their shares. Proxies are permissible for attending the meeting. Minors and interdicted persons shall be represented by their legal representatives. No member may participate in voting for themselves or for those they legally represent on matters related to a special benefit for them or a dispute between them and the company."
– Text after amendment:
"Every shareholder, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes assigned to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote for themselves or for their representative on matters related to a special benefit for them or a dispute between them and the company. Any condition or resolution to the contrary shall be void. A shareholder may appoint a proxy to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose.
Anyone who claims a right to shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of summary matters to obtain an ex parte order to disenfranchise the disputed shares from voting for a period determined by the issuing judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law."

9. Amendment to the text of Article (52) of the Articles of Association, as follows:
– Text before amendment:
"The provisions of the Commercial Companies Law No. (15) of 1960 and its amendments shall apply to all matters for which no special provision is made in the Memorandum of Association or these Articles."
– Text after amendment:
"The provisions of the Companies Law No. 1/2016, its Executive Regulations, and their subsequent amendments shall apply to all matters for which no special provision is made in the Memorandum of Association or in these Articles."
Clause Two: Approval was granted to add the following articles to the Articles of Association of Dalqan Holding Group Company:

1. Addition of a new article to the Articles of Association, numbered (54), as follows:
"The company has the right to buy or sell its own shares in accordance with the conditions stipulated in Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority and its Executive Regulations and their amendments."

2. Addition of a new article, numbered (56), as follows:
"The company shall have a special register kept with a clearing agency, in which the names of the shareholders, their nationalities, their domiciles, the number of shares owned by each of them, their type, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes to the data recorded in the shareholder register shall be noted in accordance with the data received by the company or the clearing agency. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency to provide them with data from this register."

3. Addition of a new article, numbered (57), as follows:
"A shareholder in the company shall, in particular, enjoy the following rights:
1- Receiving dividends and obtaining bonus shares that are decided to be distributed.
2- Participating in the management of the company through membership on the Board of Directors, attending General Assemblies, and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law and these Articles. Any agreement to the contrary shall be void.
3- Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly meeting, the company's financial statements for the past accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the auditor's report.
4- Disposing of their owned shares and having priority in subscribing to new shares.

The Adjourned Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Mawarid United Holding Company <orig>شركة موارد المتحدة القابضة</orig> – K.S.C. (Under Liquidation) held its meeting at 1:00 p.m. on Monday, December 23, 2024, at the headquarters of Al-Waha Auditing Office <orig>مكتب الواحة لتدقيق الحسابات</orig>, located in Sharq – Ahmed Al-Jaber Street – opposite the Fatwa and Legislation Department – Bahra Aden Mills Building – Second Floor, in the presence of:

Mr. Dr. Ali Owaid Rekhais <orig>علي عويد رخيص</orig>, the company's auditor (Al-Waha Auditing Office <orig>مكتب الواحة لتدقيق الحسابات</orig>)

After announcing that a legal quorum was present for the meeting, the Chairman of the session opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. The agenda was discussed, and the amendment of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association of the company was approved and ratified to align the company's objectives with international codes as follows:
Amendment of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association of the company

## Text of the Article Before Amendment:
The objectives for which the company was established are as follows:
1- Manufacturing, producing, selling, marketing, importing, and exporting soft drinks, water, juices, ice cream, and dairy products. (Subject to the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>)
2- Manufacturing, producing, selling, marketing, importing, and exporting tin (aluminum) cans and their corresponding lids for soft drinks, water, juices, ice cream, and dairy products. (Subject to the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>)
3- Manufacturing, producing, selling, marketing, importing, and exporting plastic and glass bottles and paper cups for soft drinks, water, juices, ice cream, and dairy products. (Subject to the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>)
4- Establishing industrial facilities to serve the company's founding objectives and importing the necessary machinery and equipment to establish these industrial facilities for the company's products. (Subject to the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>)
5- Owning the necessary means of transportation to serve the company's founding objectives.
6- Obtaining and registering agencies and leasing agencies for its products outside and inside Kuwait in accordance with the company's objectives.
7- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
8- Owning the movable and real estate properties necessary to conduct its activities within the limits permitted by law. The company may conduct the aforementioned business in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either directly or through an agent.
The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in activities similar to its own or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, purchase, or annex such entities.
9- Manufacturing and producing plastic and wooden pallets to serve the company's objectives (Subject to the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>)
10- Manufacturing and producing plastic lids for paper cups and metal caps for glass bottles, cardboard, and plastic to serve the company's objectives (Subject to the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>)

# Molly Alshaya Holding Company (K.S.C) Closed <orig>شركة مولي الشايع القابضة (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Shareholders Held on 3/3/2025

At 10:00 AM on Monday, 3/3/2025, the Extraordinary General Assembly of Molly Alshaya Holding Company (K.S.C) Closed <orig>شركة مولي الشايع القابضة (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig> (hereinafter referred to as "the Company") was held, upon the invitation of the Company's Board of Directors, to discuss the amendment of Article 3 of the Memorandum of Association and Article 1 of the Articles of Association of the Company, as stated in the agenda attached to the invitation. The meeting was held at the Company's headquarters located in Alshaya Tower, with the attendance of shareholders owning 21,000,000 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 100% of the Company's capital.
With the approval of those present, Mr. Abdullah Abdul-Latif Al-Ali Alshaya <orig>عبدالله عبداللطيف العلي الشايع</orig> chaired the meeting, and Mr. Mohammed Othman <orig>محمد عثمان</orig> served as the secretary. After reviewing the invitation procedures and the attendance sheet, the Chairman of the Board announced that the attendance of shareholders represented 100% of the total shares of the Company's capital, and therefore declared that a quorum was present and the meeting was validly convened. Accordingly, the Chairman of the meeting began by welcoming the attendees and then read out the agenda. After deliberation, the Extraordinary General Assembly approved and agreed to adopt the following resolution by a unanimous vote of all shares represented at the meeting:
(A) Approval of the amendment of Article 3 of the Memorandum of Association and Article 1 of the Articles of Association of the Company:

### Article 3 of the Memorandum of Association Before Amendment:
The name of the company is "Molly Alshaya Holding Company" <orig>شركة مولي الشايع القابضة</orig> and its commercial address is the State of Kuwait, a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed).

### Article 3 of the Memorandum of Association After Amendment:
The name of the company is "Alshaya International Holding Company" <orig>شركة الشايع الدولية القابضة</orig> and its commercial address is the State of Kuwait, a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed).

# Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding Tender No. MM/7/2024-2025
Washing and Ironing Clothes for Scholarship Students (Male and Female) in the Internal Dormitories for Scholarship Students and Female Teachers under the Department of Social and Psychological Services
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces a (public) tender for the provision of washing and ironing services for scholarship students (male and female) in the internal dormitories and for female teachers under the Department of Social and Psychological Services, in accordance with the technical conditions and specifications contained in the tender documents.

### General Instructions for Bidders:
1- The tender is (public) for bidders accredited by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- Applicants for this tender must be institutions/companies specialized in the subject matter of the tender within Kuwait, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry for the current year. They must attach certificates proving this with their bid, and these certificates must be dated concurrently with the tender announcement date.
3- This tender is indivisible, and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers.
4- The fee for obtaining a copy of the tender documents is (75 K.D.), only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>.
5- The bid must be accompanied by a preliminary guarantee of not less than (2,000/---), only two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. This guarantee must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait, issued in the name of the bidder and for the benefit of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>. This guarantee must be valid for the duration of the bid's validity. Any bid not accompanied by this guarantee will be excluded. Preliminary guarantees may not be returned until after (90) days from the tender closing date, or when the winning bidder submits the final guarantee and signs the contract, unless the tender is canceled. The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> will not pay any interest on the guarantee amount, and the bidder's creditors may not seize this amount.
6- The total duration of the contract is (2 years from the date of signing the contract), during which the contractor is obligated to execute the tender works in accordance with the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the tender documents.
7- The bidder agrees that their bid shall remain valid and in effect, irrevocable, and cannot be withdrawn from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the bid has been submitted.
8- If, upon studying the tender, the bidder finds any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect the categories of their bid or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will study these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any). This shall not result in any additional responsibility or obligation on the part of the Ministry.
9- Tender documents must be deposited in the bid box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department in the South Subhan area during official working hours, no later than (10) ten days from the date of this announcement's publication, at exactly (12:00 PM), subject to any decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No bid received after the specified closing time will be accepted, nor will any modification to the prices of submitted bids be considered after the bid has been submitted.
10- The bidder must fill out the attached schedules and provide a statement of all supplies necessary for the execution of the works subject to the tender – if any – within the same bid documents submitted. The Ministry has the right not to accept the bid if it does not include the completed schedules in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the technical specifications and conditions of the tender.
11- The bidder must submit all bank guarantees related to this tender in the Arabic language.
12- A preliminary meeting will be held one week after the date of this announcement's publication.
Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education

## Announcement
The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No. (13/2024-2025) for maintenance, restoration, and other construction works for the governorate buildings (Capital - Naif Palace, Farwaniya, Mubarak Al-Kabeer, Hawalli, Jahra - New Building, Ahmadi) for the General Directorate of Construction and Maintenance <orig>الإدارة العامة للإنشاءات والصيانة</orig>.

Specialized companies and institutions in the field of the required works that meet the following conditions:
1- The company/institution must have the financial solvency to execute the tender works, and the company's capital shall not be less than (one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), and it must have updated its data with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
2- The company/institution must have been established for at least (three years) with a license appropriate to the nature of the works subject of the tender.
3- The company/institution must have contracts for similar works within the last (five years), with a combined value of not less than (five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
4- The company/institution must not have a poor performance record with the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> or any of the state's ministries and authorities.
5- The company/institution must have a certificate of good performance from an accredited bank within the last five years.

Should review the General Directorate of Financial Affairs – Tenders Department (in Industrial Ardiya) to obtain the documents for this tender for a fee of (1,000/-) K.D., only one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (via K-Net) (non-refundable). A preliminary guarantee valid for (90) days in the amount of (25,000/-) K.D., only twenty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, must be submitted. Note that the final insurance for the tender is (10%) of the total contract value. They must bring a copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and the following documents:–
- A valid registration receipt with the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Or
- A registration request to register with the Ministry and then purchase the tender documents.

Note that the closing date (submission of bids) is Wednesday, 14/5/2025, from (8:00) eight o'clock in the morning until (1:00) one o'clock in the afternoon. No bids submitted before or after the specified time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Bid Opening Committee at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> building (Sharq area – Al-Siddiq School – First Floor).

A mandatory preliminary meeting will be held with the companies participating in the tender on Sunday, 13/4/2025, at the headquarters of the General Directorate of Construction and Maintenance <orig>الإدارة العامة للإنشاءات والصيانة</orig> at exactly (10:00 a.m.) ten o'clock in the morning. Note that any recommendations or decisions resulting from this meeting are considered an integral part of the tender documents and are binding on all companies, whether the bidder attends the mandatory preliminary meeting or not.

After examination and verification of the completeness of documents and records, the Committee decides to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for two consecutive issues. ## Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Engineering Department – Laboratories Control) announces the following tenders:

<table_caption>Tender for Medical Engineering Department - Laboratory Monitoring</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Tender No. | Description | Fees | Closing Date | State Audit Bureau Note |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| 1 | 5LB039 | Radioactive indicator for blood bags for the Central Blood Bank laboratory | 75 | 3 weeks from the date of announcement | More information on the Ministry of Health website |
| 2 | 5LB041 | Laboratory consumables for LEICA CV5030/STAINER AND COVERSILPERS-LEICA ST5020 devices | 75 | 3 weeks from the date of announcement | More information on the Ministry of Health website |
| 3 | 5LB048 | Laboratory materials for METHOTREXATE analysis on a COBAS device for the Al-Sabah Hospital <orig>مستشفى الصباح</orig> laboratories / Biochemistry unit | 75 | 3 weeks from the date of announcement | More information on the Ministry of Health website |
| 4 | 5LB053 | Consumables for all laboratories / Laboratory materials | 75 | 3 weeks from the date of announcement | More information on the Ministry of Health website |
</table>

Bids are to be placed in the tender box at the Medical Engineering Department, new building. Bids must be valid for a period of (90 days) from the closing date.
Companies wishing to participate in the tender must meet the following conditions:

2) The company must be specialized in this field and provide proof thereof.

4) An authorization letter from the company to purchase the tender documents.
5) Participating companies must submit a national labor support certificate.
6) Tender documents can be obtained starting from the publication date for a period of 21 days only.

Description of the First Property: (According to the attached description certificate)
The property of Document No. 9272/2002 located in the Faiha <orig>الفيحاء</orig> area – Plot No. (129), Block No. (7), Plan M (28388 A), with an area of 1000 m2, to be sold by public auction with a base price of KWD 1,215,000 (one million, two hundred and fifteen thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** And according to what is stated in the description certificate:
- There are violations on the property, which are:
- Light works in the yard (Kirby).
- A gypsum board room and a dividing wall in the front yard.
** And according to what is stated in the expert's report:
In the session of 4/3/2021, we proceeded to the Faiha <orig>الفيحاء</orig> area, Block 7, Ibn Al-Hani Street, House 29, where the disputed property is located, in the presence and under the guidance of the plaintiffs and the fifth defendant, and with the assistance of Mr. Abdulaziz Al-Dughaishem <orig>عبد العزيز الدغيشيم</orig>, an expert appraiser at the Administration. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The property in dispute is a private residence, overlooking two streets and bordered by two neighbors, with an area of 1000 m2.
- The property consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a roof, with the following details: - The ground floor consists of: two apartments, each containing 4 rooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, and a living room. There are two annexes; the first annex consists of a room, a bathroom, and a kitchen, and the second annex consists of two rooms, a bathroom, and a kitchen.
- The first floor consists of two apartments, each containing 4 rooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, a living room, and a balcony.
- On the roof, there is an iron shed used as a storage area.
- The exterior cladding of the house is limestone.
- The entire property is air-conditioned with window and split units, except for one apartment on the ground floor which has central air conditioning.
- There is no elevator in the property.
- Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price. To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of that price is required by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the auction will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures and under their responsibility, without the Clerks' Department <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

On 22/9/2024, we proceeded to the Al-Shaab Al-Bahri <orig>الشعب البحري</orig> area, Plot 39, Block 8, in the presence and under the guidance of both the plaintiff's attorney and the attorney for the sixth and seventh defendants, accompanied by the appraisal expert, Mr. Faisal Al-Sharhan <orig>فيصل الشرهان</orig>. Eighth: The partners have the right to object to the admission of the bidder who submitted the best offer within three days from the date the court approves their bid.
Ninth: The company and any of the partners may—even before the judgment awarding the auction is issued—settle the debt of the debtor partner to the seizing creditor.
Tenth: The company may—even before the judgment awarding the auction is issued—redeem a portion of the seized shares sufficient to satisfy the creditor's debt.
Eleventh: In the event that any of the partners object to the admission of the successful bidder to the company, and neither the company nor the partners settle the debt of the seizing creditor or redeem the shares as previously stated, the sales judge shall issue a judgment to dissolve and liquidate the company and appoint a liquidator. The judgment issued in this regard shall be appealable in accordance with the law.

** And according to the expert's report
The property subject of the lawsuit, located in the North West Sulaibikhat <orig>شمال غرب الصليبخات</orig> area – Plot (3), Street (301), Building (8), with automated number 94165729, was inspected in the presence and under the guidance of the second defendant, his representative, and the plaintiff's representative. The remaining defendants or their legal representatives failed to attend despite being properly notified. The inspection was conducted in the presence of the expert appraiser, Mr. Tariq Al-Moajil <orig>طارق المعجل</orig>, as follows:
The property where the subject unit is located is a residential building consisting of five (5) identical floors. The building is on a corner, overlooking a side square, a main street, and a side street.
The building has two (2) electric elevators.
The exterior cladding of the building is Sigma in beige and pink.
The disputed unit subject of the lawsuit is the apartment located on the second floor of the building and occupies the entire second floor.
The disputed apartment conforms in its general and specific specifications to document No. 2019/4026, with an area of 349.161 square meters, and the disputed apartment has the automated number 20475396.
The apartment consists of four (4) rooms, one (1) master room, five (5) bathrooms, a kitchen, a living room, a diwaniya, a balcony, and a maid's room with its bathroom.
- The floors of the disputed apartment are ceramic, the air conditioning is central, and its construction and finishing are new.
- The second defendant stated that he is the possessor of the disputed apartment and uses it with his children, and that the disputed apartment does not generate income.
We, along with the expert appraiser, inspected the disputed apartment on-site. The expert appraiser collected the data related to the apartment in preparation for estimating the value of the buildings and structures on its land, along with an estimate of the land's value, to determine the total value of the property, both land and buildings.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction begins at the base price indicated for the property. To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of that price is required, payable by a certified check from the drawee bank or a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session offering to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction is reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one bids with the ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid will be considered unless accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder will be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The winning bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures. The Clerk's Office of the Court of First Instance assumes no liability.
Eighth: The winning bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

## Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the winning bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

President of the Court of First Instance

## – Second: Auction Conditions:

**First:** The auction will begin at the starting price. To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of that price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.

**Second:** The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.

**Third:** If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be repeated at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale had been awarded.

**Fourth:** If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award will be adjudicated to him, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be repeated in the same session based on this new price.

**Fifth:** If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately repeated at his expense based on the price that had been awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder will be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

**Sixth:** The winning bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the expenses of the enforcement procedures amounting to K.D. 200, lawyer's and expert's fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

**Seventh:** This announcement is published in accordance with the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, and the Clerk's Office of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> shall bear no liability.

**Eighth:** The winning bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

**Notice:**
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was foreclosed is residing in the property, he shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the winning bidder is obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for a similar rent."

President of the Court of First Instance <orig>رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

Second: Auction Conditions:

Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.

## Property Description: (According to the attached Description Certificate)
A common share of 20% in the property under Document No. 2023/9535, located in the Al-Qusour <orig>القصور</orig> area – Plot No. 92 – Block No. 7 – from Plan No. M/37053 – with a total area of 400 m2. **According to the Description Certificate:**
The property is a private residence consisting of a basement + ground floor + first floor + second floor + conforms to the plans and has no violations.

**According to the Expert Inspector's Report:**
On 29/10/2023, the expert proceeded to inspect the disputed property located in the Al-Qusour <orig>القصور</orig> area, Block (7), Street (11), Plot (92). The inspection was conducted in the presence and under the guidance of the sixth defendant in person, and in the presence of the plaintiff's agent. The first, second, and third defendants, as well as the fourth, fifth, and seventh defendants, failed to attend the inspection despite being legally notified of the appointment. Mr. Saad Obaidullah Sanad Al-Daihani <orig>سعد عبيدالله سند الديحاني</orig>, the technical expert appointed by the Administration to assess the value of the property (land and building) and its total value, was also present. The inspection was carried out as follows:
1- The disputed property conforms in its general and specific specifications to Document No. 1998/16358, with an area of 400 m2.
2- The disputed property is a private residence (villa) overlooking one street with a traffic island in front of it, and has one main entrance and two side entrances.
3- The disputed property consists of a basement, a ground floor, a first floor, and a half second floor, detailed as follows:
a- The basement consists of a large hall, a dining room, a bathroom and washbasins, and a sunken courtyard.
b- The ground floor consists of a large hall, washbasins and a bathroom, a kitchen, and a room with a bathroom. It includes an annex consisting of two (2) rooms, a bathroom, and a storage room.
c- The first floor: consists of a hall, a kitchen, three (3) master bedrooms, and two rooms with a bathroom.
d- The second floor consists of a rooftop, and a half-floor structure consisting of a master bedroom, two rooms and a bathroom, and a large kitchen.
4- Exterior cladding: Mosaic tiles.
5- Air conditioning: Central.
6- Elevator: There is no elevator.
7- Nature of property use: The sixth defendant stated in the expert's report No. (5), attachment Kh(1), that those who occupy the property subject of the lawsuit are Fahad Al-Obaidan <orig>فهد العبيدان</orig> (the first defendant), Osama Al-Obaidan <orig>أسامة العبيدان</orig> and his family (the second defendant), and Mona Al-Obaidan <orig>مني العبيدان</orig> (the defen-

- The property is a one-and-a-half-story house, abandoned, unoccupied, and not in anyone's possession, and is in a dilapidated state.
- The property was entered and found to be completely abandoned, with the doors open, and is not suitable for habitation.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of that price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Execution Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full accepted price, in addition to expenses and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless another person comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures and under their responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

## Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

President of the Court of First Instance

Property Description: (According to the attached description certificate)
The property under Document No. 9989/1996, located in the Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبيخات</orig> area – Plot No. 20 – Block No. 1 – Plan M/26935, with an area of 600 m², to be sold at public auction with a base price of KWD 324,000 (three hundred twenty-four thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** According to the description certificate:
- The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor and annexes in the yard and on the ground level, and it was constructed under License 2100/1996.

** According to the expert's report:
- The disputed property located in the Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبيخات</orig> area, Block (1) – Street (4) – House (2) – Plot No. (20), with automated number (14111377), was inspected as follows:
- The disputed property conforms in its general and specific specifications to the sales contract issued by the Government of Kuwait, No. (9989) dated 03/09/1996, with an area of 600 m², submitted by the plaintiffs' attorney in his portfolio of documents at the session of 31/03/2022, document (1).
- The disputed property is an Arab-style house located on an internal street numbered (4), with a side alley, and is bordered by neighbors on two sides.
- The disputed property has two (2) entrances.
- The disputed property consists of a ground floor, an annex, and a roof, with the following details:
- The ground floor consists of two (2) storerooms – two (2) rooms – a kitchen – three (3) bathrooms.
- The annex consists of a hall – two (2) rooms – a kitchen – two (2) bathrooms – a storeroom.
- The air conditioning for the disputed property consists of window units and split units.
- The exterior cladding is of white lime brick.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full accepted price, plus expenses and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at his own risk during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at his own risk based on the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the costs of enforcement procedures amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures, and at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

Notice: 1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> stipulates that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is a resident of the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for a similar rent."

# Announcement
## Regarding Practice No. (MOJ/16-2024/2025)
Supply, installation, inspection, operation, and maintenance of spare parts for the repair of the air conditioning system at the Supreme Judicial Council building.

The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> announces to companies and institutions specialized in this field its need for the supply, installation, inspection, operation, and maintenance of spare parts for the repair of the air conditioning system at the Supreme Judicial Council <orig>المجلس الأعلى للقضاء</orig> building, in accordance with the terms and specifications detailed in the practice documents. These documents can be obtained from the Tenders Section - located in the Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> building, Block (14), Third Floor - Department of Financial Affairs <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig>, during official working hours starting from Sunday, 2025/03/16, for a non-refundable subscription fee of (75 K.D.) - only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars. Bids must be submitted to the Tenders Section at the Ministry, accompanied by a preliminary insurance of (2%) of the total bid value. This insurance must be valid for the duration of the bid's validity (90) days. The deadline for submitting bids is one o'clock in the afternoon on Sunday, 2025/04/13.

Please note that a preliminary meeting will be held at the Ministry's headquarters in the Department of Financial Affairs <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig>, located in the Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig>, Third Floor, at eleven o'clock in the morning on Tuesday, 2025/03/25. Whether the practitioner attends this meeting or not, they will be bound by any decisions or recommendations that may result from it.

- **This Practice:** Non-divisible.
- **Alternative Bids:** Submission of alternative bids is not permitted.
- **Final Time for Bid Submission:** At exactly (1:00) PM on the day specified in the announcement above for bid submission. No bid will be accepted after this time.
- The aforementioned fee is to be paid via K-Net card.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from these fees in accordance with the provisions of Article (39) of Law (74) of 2019 regarding amendments to the Public Tenders Law No. (49) of 2016.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the practice must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> certifying their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- A certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية و العمل</orig> and valid for six months, must be submitted with the bid.
- Bids must be submitted with a certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة و صناعة الكويت</orig> stating the company's registration for the year of the tender.

Director of the Financial Affairs Department <orig>مدير إدارة الشئون المالية</orig>

gov.kw by following these steps:
1- Select "Employment in Government Agencies".
2- Select "Job Seeker Registration".
3- Follow the required steps.

Second: Registration Period:
The automated system for this registration will begin operating from 12:01 AM on Friday, 28/3/2025, and will be available 24 hours a day, seven days a week, until 12:00 midnight on Friday, 11/4/2025.

Third: Registration Conditions:
(A) General Conditions:
1- The applicant must be of Kuwaiti nationality.
2- Must be at least eighteen Gregorian years of age.
3- The job seeker must not be registered with The Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> (currently employed, insured as a business owner, or retired).
4- Must not be enrolled for study in any of the schools of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, institutes and colleges of The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>, or Kuwait University <orig>جامعة الكويت</orig>, nor enrolled in studies inside or outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
5- For those with a high school diploma or less without training, it is required that a full year has passed by the end of the registration period (i.e., on 11/4/2025) since leaving their last job held in the government sector (ministries, departments, public institutions and authorities, and companies wholly owned by the state or in which the state has a share of not less than 51%, and the military sector (Interior/Defense/National Guard)). This condition will be implemented automatically through the automated system for government agencies covered by this system linked to the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>. For all others, it will be implemented by submitting documents confirming that one year has passed since leaving government service when completing the necessary procedures at the Commission.
6- Every individual registered in the central employment system is obligated, in the event of obtaining a higher academic qualification after having registered with a lower one, to update their data by visiting the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig> – Workforce Registration Department.
(B) Specialists holding university degrees, diplomas, and training course certificates issued by The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> will be registered directly without paperwork if they are recent graduates. If they are not recent graduates, an appointment will be scheduled to complete the application without the need to visit the headquarters of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>.
(C) Cases eligible for registration for those with a high school diploma or less without training:
1- Those who are over 25 years of age at the end of the registration period (i.e., on 11/4/2025).
2- Or those who are married, divorced, or widowed (male or female).

Fourth: Documents Required for Registration:
1- Paperless registration (without documents) for new graduates of Kuwait University <orig>جامعة الكويت</orig> and The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>.
2- Attested qualification certificate.
3- A copy of the Civil ID card.

Fifth: Procedures and Conditions for Accrediting Qualifications from Abroad:
1- University degrees and two-year post-secondary diplomas are to be accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education.
2- High school and intermediate school qualifications are to be accredited by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.

Sixth: Criteria for Nomination to Government Agencies:
Nomination to government agencies covered by the central employment system is carried out according to their requests and the required number for each job, for both males and females, based on the following criteria:
(A) Priority in nomination is given to those registered in the central employment system who have not been previously nominated to any agency, as well as those rejected by an agency. After that, those who have rejected an offer for the first time are nominated, followed by those who have rejected an offer more than once.
(B) Specialists holding university degrees, diplomas, or specialized course certificates issued by The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> with a duration of not less than one year, who are registered from previous employment periods and then the current period, are nominated according to the applicable nomination criteria for males and females, which are as follows: (Priority is given to the one with the higher grade for the qualification – if two are equal, priority is given to the one who obtained the qualification earlier – if two are equal, priority is given to the older one – if two are equal, priority is given to the married person over the single one.)
(C) For the nomination of non-specialists (holders of high school qualifications and below) who have not completed any training course, it is required to enroll in a qualifying course in agreement with The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>. After obtaining the qualifying course certificate, registrants from previous employment periods and then the current period are nominated according to the following criteria:
1- For males, priority is given to the oldest, then the married, then the divorced and widowed, then the single.
2- For females, priority is given to the divorced and widowed, then the married, then the single. If two are equal, priority is given to the one who obtained the qualification earlier.
(D) Excluded from clause (C) above are registrants (holders of high school qualifications and below) who have not completed any training course and wish to work in certain jobs for which there is low demand and which are designated for specific government agencies.

President of the Civil Service Commission

# National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig>
## Announcement
The National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig> announces the offering of Tender No. NCCAL 4 - (2023/2024) for the investment and management of the Dasma Theatre <orig>مسرح الدسمة</orig> under the supervision of the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig>. Specialized companies wishing to participate in this tender may obtain the tender documents for a non-refundable fee of (20 K.D.), only twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, from the Financial Affairs Department – Contracts Section – Second Floor – National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters building, Martyrs Street – Sharq.
Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is within (90 days from the date of this announcement).

All documents must be submitted on three (3) CDs, with the exception of (the bid form, the initial bid bond, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the bidder's information form).
* The tender is indivisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
* This announcement serves as an invitation for bidders wishing to attend the bid-opening session, after coordinating with the Procurement Monitoring office before the day scheduled for the bid-opening session.
* Please be advised that a preliminary meeting will be held to answer bidders' inquiries after (30 days from the date of this announcement) at 11:30 AM in the meeting hall of the Al-Qiblia School.

# Public Authority for Anti-Corruption
## Reminder Announcement to the Entities to which those Subject to the Provisions of Financial Disclosure are Affiliated
The Public Authority for Anti-Corruption <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> calls upon the entities to which those subject to the provisions of financial disclosure, as detailed in Article (2) of Law No. 2 of 2016 regarding the establishment of the Public Authority for Anti-Corruption, are affiliated, to adhere to the provisions of Articles (12, 20) of Decree-Law No. (300) of 2016 issuing the Executive Regulations of the aforementioned law, particularly concerning the following:
Notifying their affiliates of the legally specified deadlines for submitting their declarations at least one month before these deadlines expire, and providing the Authority with the measures taken in this regard, for example: the two undertaking forms mentioned in the Civil Service Commission Circular No. (19) of 2020.
To notify the Authority of the employee assigned to cooperate with it, who must be a supervisor in administrative affairs, taking into account coordination with the Authority.
To notify the Authority with a statement of their affiliates who are obligated to submit a financial disclosure declaration, indicating their job title, grade, and the description applicable to them as stated in the text of Article Two of the Law.
To notify the Authority immediately of anyone whose service has ended or whose capacity has ceased for any reason, or any change that occurs in the previous data.
To notify the Authority of the names of its representatives on the boards of directors of companies in which it directly contributes a share of not less than 25% of their capital, and it must notify the Authority of any change in the participation percentage or its legal status immediately upon its occurrence.
In all cases, these entities must provide the Authority with the data and clarifications it requests. The Authority will follow up on the performance of the duties assigned to these entities in accordance with the provisions of the law and will report to the Public Prosecution any violations of the provisions of Articles (26) and (45) paragraph (1) of the Law, in addition to informing the head of those entities of these violations to take the necessary measures to rectify them.

# Capital Markets Authority
## Announcement
Regarding the Collective Investment Scheme license granted to Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> based on Resolution No. (01) of 2025 concerning the Collective Investment Scheme license granted to Gulf Capital Investment Company to establish the Al-Lu'lu'ah Money Market Fund in Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي بالدينار الكويتي</orig> in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia, pursuant to Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and its executive regulations and their amendments, issued on 09/01/2025, and in implementation of Article Nine of the said resolution, which stipulates granting the license to the fund after completing the minimum capital requirement for a period of three years from the date of its registration in the Authority's register of funds.
The Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> announces that a license for the Al-Lu'lu'ah Money Market Fund in Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي بالدينار الكويتي</orig> in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia was issued on 05/03/2025, for a period of three years, renewable.

# Announcement (21 / 2025)
Regarding the postponement of the closing date for Bid No. 4/2023/2024 for the design, execution, management, and operation of the Educational, Cultural, and Recreational Center project on Abdullah Al-Ahad Street
Further to the announcement published in the Official Gazette, Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>, in Issue No. (1715) dated 12/1/2024, Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> announces the postponement of the closing date for Bid No. 4/2023/2024 for the design, execution, management, and operation of the Educational, Cultural, and Recreational Center project on Abdullah Al-Ahad Street for a period of 6 months, to become 9/2/2025, corresponding to Tuesday, instead of 3/4/2025.

# Announcement (27/2025)
Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> announces the Municipal Council <orig>المجلس البلدي</orig> Resolution No. (M.B/R.W/221/10/2024) C (3) taken on 12/23/2024, which grants preliminary approval in accordance with the provisions of Decree-Law No. 40 of 1978 concerning the organization of organizational plots <orig>القطع التنظيمية</orig> and Ministerial Resolution No. (325/2023) concerning the rules and procedures related to the organization of organizational plots <orig>القطع التنظيمية</orig> in application of the provisions of Decree-Law No. 40 of 1978 concerning the organization of organizational plots <orig>القطع التنظيمية</orig> and its amendments, for the reorganization of the site located in the third phase of Sabah Al-Ahmad Sea City – formerly Luluat Al-Khiran City (A3). This includes the plots owned by Mr. / Mohammed Jassim Khalid Al-Marzouq <orig>محمد جاسم خالد المرزوق</orig>, numbers (1106, 1105, 4150), designated for commercial use from survey plan No. M/37500, with respective areas of (4987m², 1616m², 10851m²), to become a single organizational plot <orig>قسيمة تنظيمية</orig> with a total area of (17454m²) seventeen thousand four hundred and fifty-four square meters and (3) parking spaces as shown on the attached plans, subject to the following conditions:
1- The concerned party shall bear all actual expenses necessary for the relocation or modification of any services, if any, without the state bearing any responsibility.
2- Adherence to the conditions and regulations stipulated in the letters from the service ministries and bearing all financial costs resulting therefrom related to the execution of works for the Ministry of Electricity and Water, the Ministry of Public Works, the Ministry of Communications, and the Public Authority for Roads and Land Transport, as stated in their letters (a copy of which is attached), provided that this is mentioned in the legal deed <orig>الوثيقة الشرعية</orig> upon registration.
Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> also invites concerned parties to submit their comments and objections, if any. A copy of this project has been displayed on the ground floor of the main Municipality building as well as in the building of the Ahmadi Governorate Municipality Branch, where the organizational plot is located. Concerned parties will be given a period of (30) days from the date of publication of this announcement to review this project and submit any objections they may have. These objections must be submitted in writing to the Director General of the Municipality during the aforementioned period.

# National Cybersecurity Center
## Announcement
The National Cybersecurity Center <orig>المركز الوطني للأمن السيبراني</orig> announces the re-issuing of Tender No. 5-2024/2025 concerning the purchase, supply, installation, and operation of NEXT GENERATION FIREWALL security devices. The tender documents can be obtained from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM at the National Cybersecurity Center building (formerly the National Security Bureau building) in Sharq, opposite the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, for a fee of 75 Dinars only.
Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is Thursday, 03-26-2025, at 12:00 PM.

<table_caption>Tender Schedule for Next Generation Firewall</table_caption>
<table>
| Issuance | Closing | Preliminary Meeting | Document Price | Notes |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 03/16/2025 | 03/26/2025 | 03/18/2025 | 75 K.D. | Meeting at 11:00 AM |
</table>

The tender is limited to specialized companies registered with the National Cybersecurity Center <orig>المركز الوطني للأمن السيبراني</orig> (registration fee is 10 Dinars only) – and small and medium enterprises.
The tender is non-divisible.
Please provide the Center with all official company documents (signature authorization, a copy of the company representative's Civil ID, national labor percentage certificate, tax compliance certificate, the company's articles of incorporation, and a certificate of payment of contributions issued by the Public Institution for Social Security as stipulated in Article 95 of the Social Security Law).

Pursuant to Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (161/2009) concerning the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in the Kuwait Municipality, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiration or to cancel their classification, and the committee stipulated in the first article of these regulations may issue its decision to that effect after the fulfillment of the following two conditions:

The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the return of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.

Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone with any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding building construction contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the construction contract, to contact the Contractors Section at the Engineering Systems Department within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the specified period.
