Acquisition by Daimler Truck AG (Germany) <orig>شركة دايملر تراك ايه جي</orig> of 50% of the shares of Iveco Truck SDV AB (Sweden) <orig>شركة إيفكو تراك اس دي في إيه بي</orig>, owned by Aktiebolaget Volvo (PLC) <orig>شركة أكتييبو لاجيت فولفو (ش.م.ع)</orig>.
In accordance with Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding competition protection and Article (83) of its Executive Regulations issued by Decision No. (14) of 2021 and its amendments, which stipulates that "Any interested party may submit a reasoned objection to the Agency regarding the economic concentration request within a period not exceeding (15) fifteen days from the date of notification or publication...".
Accordingly, the Agency invites any interested party to submit its reasoned objection to this economic concentration within a period not exceeding fifteen days from the date of this announcement.
Objection details are to be submitted at the headquarters of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>, at Al Hamra Tower <orig>برج الحمراء</orig>, 14th floor, by filling out the form available on the website and paying the prescribed fee.

The National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> announces Tender No. (NFSME/4/2024/2025) for the hosting, development, and maintenance of the Fund's electronic portal, in accordance with the general and special terms and specifications contained in the documents. 1. Provide a registration certificate issued by the Commercial Register at the Ministry of Commerce, a registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>, the company's articles of association, the company's registration certificate with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>, and a classification certificate in the Civil and Construction Works category. 3. Provide a letter of authorization from the company in the name of the person authorized to purchase the tender documents, with a copy of the Civil ID of the same authorized person and a signature authentication certificate attached.
4. Provide a valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.

Provide proof that the company has executed and completed works similar to the tender works (required and specified in the Bases and Criteria clause No. 3) within the State of Kuwait during the last ten years (from the date of the project's preliminary handover), along with a copy of the contract and the work completion certificate issued by the contracting entity.

Any questions or inquiries received by the Authority after this date will not be considered.
Second: Qualification Documents (Bases and Criteria):
The bidder must submit all documents proving fulfillment of all conditions and requirements in the Bases and Criteria with the tender documents, placing them inside the envelope designated for the Bases and Criteria requirements as follows:
1. The company must have been established, or in the case of individuals, the activity must have been practiced for more than 5 years.
2. The company's capital or the individual's owned assets must not be less than (100,000 K.D.) one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
3. Provide the complete financial statements for the company's last 3 fiscal years (income statement, statement of financial position, financial audit statement, statement of changes in equity, certified by a financial auditing office in Kuwait, with financial reports and certificates from banks the company deals with attached).
4. The bidder must have previous experience similar to the nature of the tendered works (construction of public buildings) and must have executed projects as a contractor in the field of specialization through the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> or other government entities or government-affiliated companies or institutions in the State of Kuwait during the last (10) ten years, as follows:
- One or two projects for works similar to the subject of the contract with a combined value of not less than (70,000) seventy thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- One of the two projects required above must be a government project.
- A project with a private entity must be with an institution or company that has a commercial registration with the Ministry of Commerce and Industry (Kuwait) <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة (الكويت)</orig>. 2. Provide a letter of authorization from the company in the name of the person authorized to submit the bid, with a copy of the Civil ID of the same authorized person and a signature authentication certificate attached.
3. The company's authorized representative shall place all tender documents and all required documents, as well as the qualification documents, in the designated envelope according to the instructions in the documents and the tender announcement, seal it with red wax, and then he must, on his own personal responsibility, place the first envelope [Bid Submission Envelope] in the designated box, which contains:

The bidder is not entitled to cancel it or have it seized by his creditors or claim any interest on it. Cash deposits are not accepted. ## Second: Qualification Documents (Bases and Criteria):
The bidder must submit all required documents proving fulfillment of all conditions and requirements of the bases and criteria along with the bid documents, and place them inside the envelope designated for the requirements of the bases and criteria as follows:
1. The company must have been established, or in the case of individuals, the activity must have been practiced, for more than ten years.
2. The value of the company's capital or the assets owned by the individual must not be less than (5,000,000 K.D.) five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. (or its equivalent)
3. Submission of the complete financial statements for the last (3) fiscal years of the company (income statement, statement of financial position, cash flow statement, statement of changes in equity), certified by an accredited financial auditing firm, with the financial reports and certificates from the banks with which the company deals attached.
4. Required Experience:
- **For Local Companies:**
The bidding company must have previous experience similar to the nature of the works of the offered tender (public building works) and must have executed, as a main contractor, one or two projects in the field of specialization through the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>, or other government entities, or companies or institutions affiliated with the government in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> within the last ten years from the date of preliminary acceptance, with a combined value of not less than (8,000,000 K.D.) eight million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- **For Non-Local Companies:**
- The bidding company must have previous experience similar to the nature of the works of the offered tender (public building works) and must have executed, as a main contractor, within the last ten years from the date of preliminary acceptance, one or two projects with a combined value of not less than (8,000,000 K.D.) eight million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- The bidding company must have executed at least one project as a main contractor in any construction field outside the company's country of origin within the last ten years from the date of preliminary acceptance (Gulf companies are exempt from this condition).
- It is necessary to submit copies of the contracts for the above-required projects that show the project value and its duration. Certificates of completion issued by the entities with which the contracts were made to execute the works for the same projects must also be submitted. These documents must be authenticated and certified if the projects were outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.

- Subcontracting is not acceptable.
- Multiple work order projects are not acceptable.
5. A statement of the equipment, machinery, and tools owned or leased by the contractor must be submitted, along with proof thereof, ensuring they are appropriate for the nature and volume of the works to perform their function as required.
6. In implementation and application of Article (25) of the Authority's Tenders Regulation, and Article (59) of Law No. (49) of 2016 regarding Public Tenders, the Authority has the right not to award more than one tender to a single bidder. This is in accordance with the requirements of the public interest, for tenders No. (PAHW/M/1316, PAHW/M/1317). In this case, the Authority has the right to accept the subsequent bids to execute the tenders at the lowest price offered in the subsequent bids after excluding the bidder to whom the tender was awarded.
Bidders submitting their bids for the aforementioned tenders acknowledge their full and unconditional acceptance and approval of the decisions made by the Authority in this regard. They shall not have the right to object to these decisions in any way, and the Authority shall bear no responsibility in this matter.
